description:
This was a great lil Japanese sushi restaurant in Japantown! The owners are Korean. Very clean and prompt service. I got the flaming roll being basic because everyone else's pictures and food looked amazing from the reviews. 

The roll itself was good/okay! A little watery on the bottom and kind of salty. I would get sashimi next time though cause the fish looks fresh! 

Service was so good though that it just over complimented the food profile.
author: Jessica K.

description:
The food was alright honestly..
I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).

Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll): This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi. The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too. 

Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it. 
King Kong roll- it was alright. The taste of it is fine but it just didn't necessarily impressed me. 
Overall the food was meh in my opinion. If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi. It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered. 
Service was really friendly and nice. 
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.
author: Kochamon S.

description:
Great location, easy to find and just a fun place.  Service started as soon as I walked into the restaurant.  I sat at the bar and ask the Sushi Chef for his recommends and ten minutes lates I had Salmon and Tuna Sashimi followed by a Firecracker Roll.  
The Firecracker roll was scallops and cucumber in the middle with spicy tuna on top.  Nice size and nice spice, enjoyed very much.  Sashimi was fresh, little small for the price, great with a bit of lemon.
I would come back and I would recommend.
author: David E.

description: We had made a last minute decision to come here for dinner so I didn't get time to check out the restaurant reviews. Everything was okay and nothing really stood out. We had the shooters but the oyster was so overpowering that it was all I tasted. The grilled fish was okay. The toro and uni was just okay as well. This is definitely not the place for you if you have a taste for fine sushi!
author: Teresa C.

description:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste
author: Ed U.

description:
Is pretty meh, but that's to be expected. When you go to Japantown, you're not going for the top of the line, absolutely best sushi. But you're looking to hit a craving.

Spicy Killer Roll: Not really spicy, more of a sriracha spice. The tuna on top was pretty decent.

Spider roll: Was solid, but spider rolls tend to be okay.

Nice Roll: Not so nice. The tempura shrimp was old, and really over battered. 

The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top. Not bad, was relatively fresh.

The tako in the takoyaki was pretty good, though I wish they cooked the takoyaki a little longer. The dough was a little too raw-ish.


That being said, the service was really good and people were very attentive. If the owners splurged a little for fresher product, I think this place could be much better.
author: Lily W.

description:
Came in during lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. I've walked by this place many times but have never tried the place. Feeling the hunger pains, my fiance and I decided to join the crowd inside and dine in for lunch.

They have a pretty extensive menu with countless rolls to choose from. Kinda reminds me of the neverending menu at cheesecake factory, indecisive eaters beware! That aside, we kept our choices simple. We chose the rock and roll and the spicy killer roll. Both of rolls were decent. The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish. Rick and roll hit the spot for my fiance. Overall, the experience was okay. 

A bit overpriced for mediocre rolls with decent fish quality. Quick and speedy service, however they did forget our utensils. Waitress and host seemed quite busy and ready to turn over our tables the second we finished our meals.

Don't know if I'd be willing to revisit this place again given there are far better sushi places in the area for better prices.
author: Michelle C.

description: Just ok food.  Small seating area.  Speedy service though, food didn't take long to come to the table.
author: Leticia C.

description:
Kippu is located on Buchanan St. between Sutter and Post.  It is a quaint, small Japanese Restaurant that holds about 45-50 ppl.  The menu selection is vast with many different combinations of sushi, bento boxes, and proteins (beef, chix, fish).  Pricing is comparable to that in Irvine/Costa Mesa, so I consider the price reasonable from where I live.

We ordered sushi and I have to tell you the Albacore was SOOOOO soft, it melted in our mouth as soon as it hit.  The crazy baked scallop sushi also melted in our mouths with every bite.  I would say the food here is worth coming back.  Total for 3 ppl $76: 5 sushi rolls, rolled spicy tuna (cone), and Chicken Donburi.

There are so many restaurants, it is hard to say this is a 5-Star when I have not tried them all.  Yay, I AM a fan and will return.
author: Randy L.

description: The restaurant was full, but I was told they were closed for lunch.. BS. I am traveling on business and just wanted a bite. Don't visit these bozos
author: Zach A.

description:
While visiting in SF, I was craving sushi. The sushi is great. So, if you don't care about service or may be ordering to go--this place is for you. 

We had to tell the waiter to bring us ice for our water and soy sauce dishes. It felt as if we had to ask for everything, which didn't make for a great dining experience. 

However, there were so many sushi options to choose from which I LOVE. Great food but losing stars because of service.
author: Brenda A.

description:
See my comment for photo, this is an easy fast place with deliciously fresh food. Even had toro on a Sunday night!
Toro super expensive compared to delicious meal in picture, $15/2 pc.
Worth it
author: Flo N.

description:
I was really disappointed by my visit to Kippu in Japan town. I ordered the Chicken udon soup along with some sushi. The soup hardly had any chicken. A few bits, perhaps 5 or 6 small bits. The soup wasn't very flavorful & hardly had any veg. The sushi roll (salmon, tuna, crab, avocado) was very standard with no detail or presentation.

The service was a rather hurried. I was not impressed. I had a look at what others were eating & I had ordered the same sushi roll as the couple I had seen. The bento boxes also didn't look like something I was keen on trying.

All in all there are many other places to try before I'd consider going back.
author: Julian I.

description:
I think this place is pretty accurately rated at around 3-3.5 stars. The food is run-of-the-mill Japanese American cuisine! 

The restaurant is really small - definitely not wheelchair accessible. And there are some steps out front and inside. The space to go use the restroom is also very tight and around a sharp corner. 

We got a veggie bento box and a steak teriyaki bento box late on a Friday night. Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll. 

Bento boxes were good and just as you'd expect. It seems vegetarians have quite a few options! 
The steak teriyaki was tender and not over cooked. The portion felt fair. 

The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them. 

The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
author: Amy R.

description:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!
author: Tammy P.

description:
Incredible sushi, terrible service. I ordered the cherry blossom roll and was not disappointed. I loved the salmon as it was fresh, soft, and nicely cut. However, the staff was on the rude side and things took a while to come out. 

If you're not in a rush and don't mind bad service, this is the spot for you.
author: Manuela R.

description:
I'd have to say, this place improved quite a bit.


Located in the heart of Japantown.


About 3 years ago I've tried this sushi joint and thought it was just okay. I decided to give it another try last week during the weekday and boy was I surprised! 

The First thing I noticed was the deco: they definitely cleaned up nicely compared to my last visit.

Second, the food presentation bumped up quite a bit! Dishes were wonderfully plated, meticulous even.

Third, most important of all it seemed as though they've improved on the quality of the ingredients. I wouldn't say it was the absolute best quality but reasonably decent for its price.


Things to try:

1. Flaming Dragon - I'm not much of a sushi roll person but if you are, this is a definite must try! Baked salmon with avocado and crabmeat with a special sauce which reminds me of Lion King Roll(which is another good roll). Doesn't hurt that it has a theatrical effect with the actual FLAME which adds a finishing touch to the baked flavors of the neatly aluminum wrapped roll(which they'll peel for you once the flame is out).

2. 22pc sashimi combo - This was my favorite. Of course pricier than sushi rolls, but the meticulous attention to detail and the fresh ingredients used made it my most memorable of my visit.

3. Vege Tempura - Again I'm not a big fan of tempura, but one member of my party wanted to try it so we decided to split it. I ended up grabbing a few pieces of my own and was delightfully surprised! Crisp, vegetables cooked to tenderness, solid tempura that made me craving for more!

4. Service was incredibly attentive, which is expected at a Japanese restaurant.





Overall: If you've made it this far in the review then I'd like to congratulate you :)




Kippu is a cute and modern sushi-stop with a twist of traditional charm. Nice job! 





Con:
Not good for big party, small dining room. 2-4ppl should fit comfortably.
author: Sono S.

description:
I am so confused as to why there are so many negative reviews! 

Came here for a quick lunch with a friend, and I was thoroughly impressed. 

Upon sitting, we were asked what we wanted to drink (I think the waitress could see all the sweat dripping from my face, as we conquered a few hills to reach Kippu). We were served water promptly.

To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

Both were fantastic. The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up. 

My friend got a bento box with chicken teriyaki and tempura. I got the bento with chicken teriyaki and gyoza. 

Was it good? 

Well, with little talking in between, at the end I looked at our bento boxes. Every section of each of our bentos was cleaned out. 

It was good. 

A huge bonus and very much appreciated was the service. EFFICIENT and FRIENDLY! 

Seriously, as soon as we finished our appetizers, the empty/dirty dishes were immediately removed or replaced. Water was constantly filled up. When we finished one dish, the waitress would remind us that our next dishes were still on the way.

5/5 Stars. See you again, Kippu.
author: Michael T.

description: My group of friends came here for a late lunch and were seated quickly, but the restaurant itself was so hot inside, I probably would've preferred eating elsewhere. Then along came the service and I wish I DID eat elsewhere. The girl who served us was completely void of any emotion and so rushed, that she walked away before my friend could even order. Mind you, my girlfriend is mild mannered and the moment her nostrils flared due to the girl's rude demeanor, I already knew this place wasn't going to get a good review from me. The food was good - hence the 2 stars, but service is key and they need to improve theirs remarkably.
author: Lang N.

description:
We sat at the sushi bar and were happily surprised. Kippu was the only open restaurant later in the evening that seemed more dedicated to sushi (with an actual sushi bar). We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).   We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good. Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected. More importantly the sushi rice was a really well done: vinegar with just a touch of sweet, very similar to my own recipe. I'm pretty sure the place was Korean owned, which isn't a surprise these days in J-town.  

The service was a bit sparse, as it was two hosts/servers/bussers for maybe 15 tables and you could not order anything, even sushi, via the sushi bar.  So ordering, paying, etc., often had a bit more wait than expected. 

Overall, I was really happy with Kippu and would definitely stop in again.
author: Jason G.

description:
The sushi was delicious and moderately priced, however, the service was lacking. We had just taken the last bite of food (hadn't even finished our beers) when the server gave us the check and asked if we could finish up because they had tables waiting. I waited tables in college and i am always aware how long my party sits at a table (i couldn't stand "campers"). 

Because of the rush out the door, I'm giving 2 stars.
author: Nick M.

description:
They were the only spot open on New Year's Day. I know it's hard to be open on New Year's day BUT the service and food were both pretty bad. We were ignored at the hostess stand for a good 10 minutes. Finally we were acknowledged after I said something to the hostess. 

My husband ordered the sashimi lunch box and I got the teriyaki chicken (afraid to eat the sushi based on other reviews). His salmon sashimi was inedible. The sushi was so slimy and warm. He had me look at it and it looked pretty bad. He ate a little bit and confirmed it wasn't fit to eat. We ate the chicken and rice. I had my california roll (which was grocery store quality). 

When we were done I had to flag down the waiter for the bill. Once I got the bill from him, he never asked me if I needed a box. The bill was set to pay and he was still MIA. I went up to the hostess stand and had to ask for a box which took much longer. 

I know they were busy and it's a hard day to be open but this was a pretty bad experience. I didn't mention the sushi to the server but because they seemed so busy and kept ignoring us, I figured it wasn't even worth mentioning to them anyway.. or they would ignore me. 

I'm from the east coast so I probably won't ever be back here but I wanted to let folks know regardless. If there are other options, try elsewhere!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Yeah...pretty much what you'd expect eating in Japan town. It's high-priced, mediocre Japanese food geared for tourists. Whenever I come to Japan town I hardly actually eat in restaurants in or immediately surrounding the shopping center, but was particularly hungry that day. We ordered a bento box (chicken teriyaki, tempura, California rolls) - which was fine. It wasn't bad at all, but was nothing special either. I had the chirashi and for $25 it was sooo small. It only had a few slices of fish. I'm no fish expert but I saw salmon and tuna, of course, and then like maybe two other kinds. 

The place itself was a little crowded. They jammed in as many tables as they could, which I  don't mind, but it's like all the bodies in the restaurant made the place so stuffy and hot. They should really turn on the fan or something. Customer service was also fine. They were nice. 

Anyway, everything about this place is pretty average, except the prices, which is high for what you get.
author: Judy H.

description:
Welp, safe to say you'll never see me in here again. I came in with a group of friends on a not-too-busy night, no wait but the number of seated parties convinced us that it would probably be an alright place. 

Before we get too deep in it, I do want to acknowledge the wait staff and their attentiveness. It's not their fault the food made our whole group sick. 

We kicked off dinner with sake and beer, so far so good. Our server made sure we all had enough to drink. We placed our orders; some standard rolls, miso soups, and a bento box. The food looked questionable when it came out - against my better judgement and having had my fair share of grocery store sushi, I figured I'd be okay. Boy, was I wrong. The raw fish was on the warm, chewy side but I ignored my gut (at first) and powered through. Everyone in the group had their fill, we paid the bill, and went on our merry way. 

Fast forward five hours to the middle of the night. I could not ignore my gut anymore and...well, I'll spare the gory details. I followed up with my pals and the story was consistent across the board. 

I wanted to like this place, but for my own good and health I can't.
author: Erika D.

description: Racist workers. Bad service. Takes a long time to serve us the food and the food are not even that good. Not worth the wait
author: Mark F.

description: Delicious! The nabeyaki udon and beef teriyaki bento box was just absolutely tasty. The service is really nice too.
author: Kiara K.

description: Nothing left and the food was delicious. Service was great too, but be ready for some very limited drink options and refills are not free. Pretty expensive dinner.
author: Jessica H.

description: This place located in the heart of Japan Town. Food is normally good. Salad is a little dry and not as fresh as it should. Waiter took the signed pay slip prior to end of meal, it costs a star!
author: Steve H.

description: Pages of rolls to choose from with your regular added Japanese food selections as well. This is the only location that gives you complimentary miso soup & salad with your entree in comparison to the other sushi spots located in Japan Town. Prices are super reasonable & service is absolutely excellent! My grandma kinda VIP over here (she's here all the time lol)  too so we always get great service here & their food is soo good.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Pros:
- complimentary starter Miso Soup
- open on Christmas Day
- complimentary starter salad to share
- reasonable prices

Cons:
- our waters were never refilled 
- the starter salads are apparently to share..? So for the 4 of us they only brought out 2 small salad bowls. I was coming down with a cold so my family didn't want to share a bowl with me and risk getting sick, so I didn't get any salad :( 
- kind of small portion sizes
- veggie spring rolls were pretty bland and unauthentic

Overall this place was pretty average. I didn't dislike any of it and considering it was one of the only places I could find that was open on Christmas, it was perfectly fine. However I do wish I could have gotten a water refill and maybe the salads could be individual rather than shared.
author: Birgen D.

description:
Super slow service when we're the only ones there. Super high prices for an average bento box.

Only in Japan Town would this place survive.

No refills on tea no extra napkins.

Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.

Ugh, only because I was hungry.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because the salmon portion was big, but not necessarily that good to want a second helping.
author: Jack R.

description:
I love Kippu! My go to spot when I want a bento box. Customer service has always been good here and the food is great. I don't know if the guy with the highlighted hair is the owner or manager, but he's usually there every time I go by and he's always been really nice. I appreciate that. 

The tempura here is one of my favorites. I like how they include the tempura onion rings in the tempura. I don't see that too often at Japanese spots. I like how Kippu is right in the middle of Japantown. It's like you're eating a bento box in Tokyo. 

Another big plus here in the price. They have great lunch prices. I think it's like $8 for Chicken Teriyaki bento box with tempura. Great food, great service, cool location I can't ask for more. I'll be back a few times this week. Thank you Kippu!
author: Philip O.

description: Stopped in Kippu after seeing all the other restaurants around were closed/had a waiting line and we don't regret it. Service was good and very fast, the menu is quite long and varied with many options of rolls, sushis, ramens, udons and bentos. We got the udon which was very tasty, def one of the best we've had since a long time. The roll was a bit less flavorful but still reasonably good  overall a good place, strongly recommend, except for one small detail : pleaaase find another type of music than random radio hits and it'd be perf
author: Louisa S.

description: I stopped in for a roll and did not realize until after I ordered that all crab meat was imitation... that is a big party foul in my book... tasted fine but not like crab. I immediately referenced the menu and at the bottom in fine print read,  "All the crabs are imitation crab" I can get sushi like this in Oklahoma...
author: Philip C.

description:
Food was so so. I would say maybe 2.5 stars. But service was just lousy. We were a big group of 11 and from the time we started placing our orders to the time we're almost done with our meal, the servers couldn't bring enough small plates coz they're out of it, and it took them so long to bring us a bowl of rice, which they ended up charging us 2 bowls instead, and most importantly, one of the staffs had the worst attitude. I politely asked if they do parking validation and he just snapped at me and gave me a very rude "NO" even before I could finish my sentence. My husband went to pay the bill and a few minutes later, one server brought us the check (that's how I found out they charged us for 2 bowls of rice instead of one). I told the guy about it but we already paid and instead of issuing us a refund, he just changed the check and put it back at our table. My husband said it's ok and we're just gonna leave. That's when the bad attitude staff pointed to us and told us the check is on the table, like as if we hadn't paid yet. We told him the bill has been paid and he wasn't happy at all. 
I'm from L.A. and I've been to so many sushi places but never yet experience this kind of service and ill mannered attitude from servers or staff in a restaurant. I will never go back to this restaurant nor recommend it to my friends.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
I should've checked Yelp before coming here. My mom suggested this restaurant because she came here with friends and really liked it. Kippu is located across the street from Japan Town in a less busy plaza. 

Walking in, there was a lot less people than you would find in your typical Japan Town eatery. I ordered a sushi roll (forgot the name) but it was shaped as a flower blossom with salmon on the outside and tuna on the inside. My mom ordered the beef bento box with sashmi. I thought that my roll was very small. The fish also did not taste super fresh. The overall service was decent, it took time a while for us to get our bill. I think the food here is just average, go across to the main plaza... they have much better food!
author: Andy L.

description:
Karage chicken  is small like pop corn chicken
Sushi rolls are small , ordered the candy cane roll , 8 pieces size like California roll ...disappointed but there is only very few restaurant open around 9:30 pm at night
author: Phoebe W.

description:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

~List of dishes I've tried~
1. Four Seasons Roll
2. Seaweed Salad
3. Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4. Love Roll
5. Avocado Roll
6. Hamachi Lover Roll
7. Miso Soup
8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

All Perfection! :)
author: Wolf B.

description: First time eating here. Staff is very friendly. Service was fast. Lunch bento boxes we very affordably priced.
author: Cee ..

description: Hella slow service we were basically ignored for the 20 minutes after we sat down, no one ask if we were ready or brought water to us
author: Zeyu L.

description: Came here for lunch during the Cherry Blossom Festival and similar to other restaurants, it was packed and expect a wait. Food here is good although their Udon Noodle soup tasted full of MSG. The food does come quick though, and understandably trying to get a stsaff to refill of water was a bit difficult.
author: Eric T.

description:
Positive: Excellent selection of specialty rolls.
Negative: On our visit the staff wasn't firing on all cylinders; it was a *very* busy day during the 2017 holiday break, but ... they forgot an item, mistakenly delivered - and removed - two different bento boxes, some of the sashimi was still frozen, the rice was "al dente" and the beef was raw in the middle. Perhaps this wasn't the regular staff?
author: Mark W.

description:
Family and I are visiting from San Diego and wanted to eat in Japantown our first night.

Came across this place and decided to give it a try. They have a large selection of sushi as well as other dishes. I tried the veggie don which wasn't bad at all. The staff was friendly and sweet. We got our food rather quickly which was nice, considering we were starving.

If you're visiting Japan town, I'd recommend this place.
author: Jessica N.

description: If you want the best value possible when in San Francisco, please consider visiting Kippu. Of course, I am not a San Fran native - I hail from a frosty midwestern town where sushi is subpar; however, I know a good deal when I see it. The sashimi pieces were HUGE - big enough where I dropped it in my soy sauce and splattered my shirt by accident (and I'm usually good with chopsticks). We had a boat deal for $69 which included four rolls and many pieces of sashimi. I requested that all of my sashimi be salmon, but you can sample quite a few using this deal. The rolls were fantastic, but be warned - their spicy tuna is so spicy my nose began running one piece in. I attacked the sashimi full force and still struggled to finish it.
author: Carrie K.

description: Cool place, huge choice of sushi. Service is fine. Pretty decent place. Nothing extraordinary but not bad.
author: Ami K.

description: Enjoyed my meal here. Sushi and sashimi serving and a y'all beer. The staff were all terrific. The fish just didn't have very much flavor. The nigiri rice was well cooked, just too much vinegar for my tastes. I appreciate this as a lunch place. Cheap sushi, but nothing impressive here. 3.5 is my official review.
author: JWest M.

description:
Small Japanese restaurant in Japantown. Miso soup was hot and lots of tofu. Hubby ordered poke bowl and I had shrimp & vegetables tempura. Both meals look very appetizing when placed in front of us. The taste was average. I was a little disappointed with my tempura because there was so much batter that I had to pick some of it off before eating. 

I guess I had higher expectations for a Japanese restaurant in Japantown... not terrible, however, not fantastic either. Just OK.
author: Rika W.

description:
Was walking around Japantown with the family searching for dinner and came across this place!
There was no wait to be seated (but it had its people) and the servers were attentive! The food was delicious and very filling!!
The only thing I wasn't too keen about were the cups for water, but everything else was great!!!
Everyone left full and satisfied!^^
author: Gabby O.

description: Had a great bowl of Pork Bone Raman, just as good as this one favorite place of mine in Tokyo.
author: Danny N.

description: Fresh and yummy sushi and the ambiance was perfect for a day date. The complementary salad and miso was yummy, too!
author: Ciara C.

description: Great sushi! The meal came with complimentary miso salad. Staff was nice and friendly and attentive. I definitely will come back again! We got the rainbow roll, Philadelphia and cherry blossom. All were great and had very reasonable pricing.
author: Cameron W.

description: Came on Friday afternoon, had the Titanic and Delicious Roll, very good. Respectful and Quick service.
author: Cyndi F.

description: I'd call this restaurant the epitome of a 3 star rating. The service was friendly enough, but not great. Case in point: asked to get new edamame - the ones we were served were cold and had clearly been sitting for a while... they came back with our same edamame just microwaved. The prices were standard sushi prices: $7-17 per roll. The ambiance was standard modern sushi joint: bright colors and fast paced music in the background with plenty of natural and man made light with Asian decor. The rolls themselves were good - nothing new, nothing very traditional, just, standard American sushi.
author: Dan E.

description: Solid sushi place in Japan town. I was very happy with the service and the ambiance. Reasonable prices for what you get. Pretty authentic staff and food was awesome. Being part Japanese, I was very happy with everything at kippu, and I have some high standards. I recommend to anyone in Japan town looking for a good sushi dinner, and not ready to drop half a paycheck.
author: Ross S.

description: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.
author: Rose Marie J.

description: This is our favorite sushi place in San Francisco. Good quality fish, large selection, quick service.
author: Inessa B.

description: Six of us showed up and continued to order three or four rolls at a time till we were full, they were very friendly and attentive. We all enjoyed every roll ordered and felt they were of good quality.
author: Marissa N.

description: Ok sushi, the rolls are small, fish doesn't taste super fresh but for sushi it's always good to give a second chance on a different day of the week since we don't know when they receive their delivery. I went on a Thursday. Service was excellent. Miso was good and super hot!
author: J. S.

description:
yummy rolls and fast service. The price is not really high comparing other restaurant in japan town and also they open lunch time between 2pm- 5pm. Many choices of rolls which you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, it's a great restaurant to chill out with friends.
Highly recommend to friends
author: Vivian Q.

description: i've been wanting to try this place for awhile, and sadly, it was disappointing. i was initial drawn to their wide selection of sushi rolls, which is terrific, but while it did come to the table quickly, the sushi rice has too much vinegar and overpowered the rolls. plus, my gf's udon took a long time to come; although the sushi did come quick, we finished the sushi well before it arrived. the service was not good; while the young female was working her tail off (as well as the sushi chefs), the middle-aged woman was a little rude. with the wide selection of sushi restaurants so close by, i have other restaurants to try and doubt i'll return.
author: Mike C.

description:
The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes. 

Came here while I was waiting to get my visa from across the street. Food took awhile to come but it was good. The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet. The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up. The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one but he immediately noticed and called the server to hand me one.

Food is 3 stars but because of their attentiveness, they deserve 4 stars.
author: Angelyn S.

description: They have a great variety of sushi rolls. The sake was good and the service was also good but they can improve a bit. I was expecting higher quality type of sushi since they are in Japantown.
author: Martin A.

description: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty. The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.
author: Francine B.

description: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it. We also had gyoza, the bomb, and a couple other rolls. All just ok, not great. Wouldn't go back.
author: Dustin M.

description:
Why there are no good Japanese restaurants in Japantown is beyond reason.  Kippu is yet another restaurant that's not stellar.  We were looking for a place to dine on Thanksgiving Day for a late lunch; this seems to be the only other restaurant (Japanese unless you prefer Korean of which there were several in Japantown of all places) that was open in addition to Mifune.

The service was totally harried and too efficient in a bad way.  If one wanted to request something from the server she was either rushing around seating other diners or getting orders to the tables.  It was just chaotic and irritating to have to flag the server down.

Otherwise, the food was pretty substandard & portions meager for the high prices charged.

A bowl of seafood udon consisted of two medium sized prawns, one (yes, one) bay shrimp, and a tiny smattering of what they consider mussels (the tiniest they could buy and without shells).  Oh, there was one miniscule piece of squid's tentacles included with maybe two slivers of carrot. All of this at a price of $14.95.  Robbery.  The rolls were just ok.  And their bento boxes were beyond overpriced for what one got (e.g. thinnest cut of salmon).

So they were packed on Thanksgiving Day not because they're great but because nothing else except Mifune was open.
author: Luisa T.

description: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.
author: Joshua M.

description: We stopped here on our visit to SF. Went to Japan Town. Was moderately busy. We aat down before looking at reviews. Service was poor. No one said hello to us for 5 minutes. We then got promptly seated. I ordered a hot tea which was good, but never got refilled and was probably a 3oz cup. Both my wife and I got Bento Boxes. These were reasonably priced , but they never brought either of us miso soup. My Bento Box came with 3 pieces of sashimi. The sashimi was dangerous looking. It was warm, slimey, smelled and was,falling apart. I tested a small bit and decided it was unsafe to eat. No one asked us how our meal was or checked in on us. Wish I had checked yelp reviews before going. The owner, or manager was nice, but was not a great experience in food or service. 2 stars because the teriyaki chicken and tempura were decent. Rest of the meal was unpleasant.
author: Oliver B.

description: Horrible customer service.  They forgot one of the five orders.  They didnt bring us the miso soup because they were still cooking,  which is fine.  However,  they delivered to other tables miso soup first while we have been waiting for 10 mins.
author: Yilam M.

description: The service here was not all that great. They forgot ALL of the appetizers we ordered so they retook that order and still forgot one. They brought out our entrees before we got any appetizers and then charged our credit card 3 times! One of the charges was for a completely different table too.
author: Gabriela M.

description:
I expected decent Japanese food in Japantown, but also expected it to be generic.

Kippu managed to surprise me a bit because their sashimi lunch was really nice and tasty (and yes somewhat generic -but better than I expected.)

I picked Kippu because most of the other places emphasized noodles (which I also like) - but this seemed more geared to sushi and sashimi.
author: Dan D.

description: Delicious, affordable lunch special. I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9. Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while
author: Matt M.

description: Kipppuuuu. Cool thing bout it is that they have tons of funny sushi names on the menu is all I remember. But I went with some homies who all got bento boxes because the boxes are a bit healthier (you can pick around the carbs and such better). Anyways it's right in the heart of Japan town so definitely check it out and walk around the area if you get a chance.
author: Willy X.

description:
When I heard that they have a Japantown in the city I had to get me some sushi!  My friend brought me here and the food wasn't that bad.  I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.  They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.  Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup just like they do in Japan haha.  Drink up!

The food is where the authentic culture ends.  The music selection was great but very American.  They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll. It looked delicious!
author: Brittany W.

description:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.
author: Molly I.

description: Polite, prompt service, good food. They gave me a free starter of some miso soup while I looked at the menu.  I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice. It hit the spot!
author: Aleta D.

description:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.
author: Matthew L.

description: This place has a little bit of everything Japanese including takoyaki AND they have creative rolls. The rolls may not have have thick cuts like some other places but the quality of the fish was very good.
author: sammy k.

description: This is right place to have good roll sushi in Japan town..many choices of rolls and quick nice services. They also not closing for lunch break between 2 to 5 as any other typical Japanese restaurant in town..I got here Thursday around 3pm and ordered two rolls and fried chicken..they were solid and tasty..I will definitely come back here with my girlfriend
author: Seung Jun L.

description:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
author: Leonard L.

description:
Woah, 
We just left this place and not only am I disgusted, my intelligence was insulted by the sushi chef and the manager. A worm had made it's way to the surface of the tuna. And it bent its self around. I blinked several times to make sure what I was seeing was correct then I poked at it with my chopstick and it disappeared. I dug it out with the chopstick then showed it to the chef and the waiter. They both told me that it was a vein.  I explained to them that veins don't actually move in dead fish. I'll send them the medical bill when I birth the several hydra that form from this dining experience.  -no stars
author: Mila G.

description: I just really didn't like this place. The service was okay, but the salmon bento that they advertise for $10.50 should've been more like $4.50. The "bento" was veiled as a thinly sliced salmon patty with minimum rice, seaweed salad and iceberg lettuce (Forgot a picture). With so many good Japanese restaurants in SF I hate to rip on local business but guys charge more and put more on the plate, your bento was pitiful.
author: Justin F.

description: Very good value and excellent food. You can't beat the $8.50 chicken Bento box. The servers are very attentive. Very nice people.  Bento Box is now gone..the atmosphere is boring and just transaction oriented. No fun. No love. Ugh.
author: David S.

description:
I was recently in San Francisco on vacation and looking for some good Japanese food while wandering around Japantown. While most restaurants were closed (Friday after Thanksgiving) and Kippu was one of the few that was open. I hesitated quite a bit since I saw that most people on Yelp gave it poor reviews. 

I am going to be super blunt as I've been fortunate to have eaten Japanese ranging from sushi/sashimi/omakase/etc at 2 star michelin restaurants to mini back alley places in Tokyo. People in San Francisco simply don't know what they are talking about or are simply too picky. I'd ordinarily give this place 3.5 stars, but based on all these BS reviews, I have to be objective and cut completely the opposite way. The sushi was fresh and arrived quickly. Would I say it was out of this world? Absolutely not, but without a doubt it is good, and the menu is quite extensive.

So now, lets move onto service which is another place where people are busy trashing this establishment. Our waiter was quick, refilled our water and kept asking if we needed more napkins or wanted to order more rolls. More myths debunked. To anyone who is in Japantown and looking for a quick, solid meal this more than fits the bill. Oh, and it won't break the bank either.
author: Hikaru N.

description: One of my favorite sushi places in the city! Every single dish I've had here has been great. My boyfriend didn't think he liked sushi until I brought him here. On top of the great food, service has been consistently good. No complaints at all.
author: Sara J.

description:
We were in Japantown for the Soy and Tofu Festival and decide to get a quick drink and snack in the area. We walked in the place was pretty empty.

They had pretty good drink specials and the food seemed reasonably priced. We ordered a pitcher to share and I ordered a salmon skin handroll to tide me over until dinner. The drinks were cold and delicious but the sushi left quite a bit to be desired. It wasn't bad, just wasn't great and that the was the consensus around the table. 

I would recommend the place for great drink specials, but skip the food.
author: Emily R.

description:
It was quite the unbelievable experience. In fact, it was so unbelievable that I wasn't willing to believe and I was giving them the benefit of a doubt, despite my best friend telling me otherwise (my bad). But when we were sitting there for 20 minutes and 2 tables that were seated after us got served before us, I just had to ask about our food. It was only 2 sushi rolls...

The waitress that took our order told me, without any hesitation, that our food was coming. She comes back a few minutes later to tell us that they actually missed/forgot our order. Our order happens to arrive not more than 5 minutes later...so you mean we could've finished our food and been outta there 15 minutes ago???

So after we finish our food, another employee walks over and asks us how everything was and apologized for the wait with a pat on best friend's shoulder. Uhhhhh...really? Which part are you sorry about? Forgetting our order? Or lying about it? And how sorry are you really? Enough to discount our order? Apparently not...

On top of that, the fish wasn't fresh. The food wasn't great for the price that we were paying.

And in other news, we were sat in the small table in the middle of the room. Yeah, it makes sense to seat us there because we were just a party of 2. But honestly, people kinda need to squeeze by when you're sitting there. They either don't expect their restaurant to get that packed or they really don't care that their customers are bumping up against other customers. That's awfully nice.
author: Athena C.

description: The sushi is fairly good and the service was great. Very nice and very quick. Attentive as well. I would certainly recommend trying it out. They have over 72 different sushi rolls to try so I will be coming back for more!
author: Evan B.

description: I recently ordered a flaming dragon around 7:30pm 07/31/17. The presentation was amazing but when I tried the roll it tasted like gasoline. Me and my friend now feel nauseous, lightheaded and our stomach works. If you get this roll check if there's a hole on the foil.
author: Ian L.

description:
Great inexpensive sushi restaurant. I went here with my parents and we got 5 rolls for 3 people (I could have been fine with 4 but my dad wanted another). We went at 5pm on a Sunday (Fathers Day) and it was pretty empty and we got great service.

Atmosphere: right in japantown, very authentic. the waitstaff was very attentive in getting our orders, refilling our waters, and bringing us the food on time

Food: They bring you complimentary miso soup as soon as you sit down, and then house salad once you order your sushi! It was so great!! For our rolls, we got the carmen, delicious, double salmon, (another one I forgot) and then the flaming dragon. The fish was very fresh, and the only roll we didn't really like was the Flaming Dragon. It's apparently one of the most popular rolls, but I think that's only because it comes out in flames. The flames cook the fish, which makes it weird and not that good.

Overall: I would definitely come here again. I would love to try the bay scallop and lion king rolls (their other two most popular rolls).
author: Jenna G.

description: Delicious sushi, kind staff, and prompt service.  The atmosphere was nothing super special, but I was happy to stop here for dinner while visiting San Francsico.  The Go Go Roll was especially tasty.
author: Kate J.

description: I walk in at 8:30 and they yell at me to tell me "sorry we're closed. We close at 9." What the heck? Not gonna make assumptions, but my husband who walked in with me has been discriminated against plenty of times. This place is a joke.
author: J F.

description:
We ordered several things -- noodles, sushi, rolls....The noodles WAY too salty. Think salt lick like for the broth.
Kinda stingy on the rolls -- we agreed that was not worth it.
Service not good. Mainly one of the guy waiters. So many other places to go around here, so no one should have to settle for apathetic service.
A thumbs down from us.
author: John G.

description: I've had better... Lunch special, terriyaki bento box. Every thing was aight. Very basic foods and service was slowwww.
author: Luc L.

description:
I admit that I have no experience with other sushi places in SF, and I expect many of them are amazing, but for a tourist Kippu was friedly, interesting, and exceptional.

The staff was friendly and fast and didn't mind me ordering several items individually.  Each was well prepared and presented and would land this place among the top Sushi joints in any other town.
author: Jason R.

description:
Fairly decent sushi. I ordered Sushi Combo C, which had 7 nigiris and a tekka roll, which costed $17, so the price is definitely on the high end. The sushi was ok, but wasn't exceptional as I had expected beforehand, and the variety is very narrow (all the nigiris in the combo were of red/white fish pieces--there was no color e.g. egg, octopus, fish roe etc, which was disappointing).

Would definitely recommend finding sushi elsewhere e.g. the conveyor belt sushi boat places, where you can find a much larger variety of fish selection
author: Henry L.

description:
*churrs lightly* 
Ah Japantown. always a wonderful place to go for this cat. growing up nearby, trips to Japantown always meant that some good Japanese food would likely be a part of each trip.  whether it be a sit down meal at a restaurant, or a quick to go item from nijiya market, "J-Town" is all about good food.

I decided to take a venture to this little side restaurant with some friends of mine. I had seen Kippu before, but never got the chance to give them a try, so for the sake of adventure, I did. 

Kippu is a very cozy narrow restaurant that seems to have mostly younger people working there. I noticed that their menu had many wonderful pictures of the different sushi rolls they offered, and instantly I became quite excited to give a few a try. 

I saw numerous individuals on yelp talking about the "flaming dragon" roll, so I opted to give that a try. my friends ordered some other rolls to sample. and after a bit of a wait, we were served. 

of the numerous rolls we had, I feel that while they were quite good, some of the fish didn't taste very "fresh" to me. not that they were old or spoiled, just that I feel I have tasted fresher. maybe that's just the cat in me being picky, but that is my feeling. the flavor of the rolls we had were decent, nothing too crazy or overwhelming, basically your standard decent sushi. 

the flaming dragon I saw many speaking of is definitely a show piece! they bring the foil wrapped roll on FIRE which is visually appealing. although I feel the roll itself while good, wasn't too much special. 

service here is very nice and polite and they were very attentive to us which I highly appreciate. 

overall, I'd say that Kippu is a fairly priced sushi restaurant that isn't the best in the world, but isn't bad either! worth a shot if you are in japantown and don't want to go to one of the "main" restaurants in the mall. 
*Chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
It's just so so- in normal level. Nothing special.
一般般，有点油腻，普通水准，不难吃，没有什么特别的。
author: Mandy X.

description:
We went in here and the food was decent. Rolls are big. Giving 1 star because they mixed my order up and refused to fix it. Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll. They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.

I was given the unagi rolll and I brought it to the wait staff's attention. They told me it was a dragon roll. They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate. However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it. Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

Just remake the roll for god sakes.
author: Eric H.

description:
Yo, the food here sucks. You know when the man topping for all dishes is sriracha, they probably aren't the most skilled when it comes to culinary arts.

I chose this place for my birthday dinner with my sisters because it looked super cute from the outside. The wait staff and pleasing aesthetics earn the two stars.

The food was awful though. You'd think a restaurant can't go wrong with raw oysters...lol...each oyster was "decorated" with a dot of sriracha. Then we had the seared ahi tuna, again "decorated" with sricacha. The oyster shooters were somewhat bearable; this was a mix of mostly ponzu sauce and maybe a drop of sake with a quail egg and a very good sized oyster. My middle sister did gag on the ponzu mixture though. Hahaha.

The roll we ordered had a decent amount of baked scallops on it, but this is not enough to come back! Go to another place! Good birthday memory. Hahaha.
author: Michelle N.

description: When i walked into the restaurant i was wondering why it was so hot in there. We just ate some burgers so we were already full but we took a stroll through japan town and we stumbled upon this restaurant and my girlfriend and i will never ever say no to some sushi! I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too. Its like a full course meal. We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll... They were just alright they left the seeds in the lemon toppings. Their service was really quick! Thumbs up
author: Pu B.

description:
I would highly recommend getting the flaming roll and the lion king roll (one of the best lion king roles I've had in the city). Very flavorful with a mix of sauces including mustard (tastes surprisingly good). One thing I would critic is the service is not that great it seems like it is a very rushed setting where their trying to get you in and out as fast as possible,

I love the location its in the center of Japan town with a lot of shopping and Fillmore street right around the corner.

Check it out for some good sushi in the city.
author: Kunal T.

description: Super small portion for not so cheap prices. Paid $35 for two tiny rolls with small pieces of fish, and six pieces of Gyoza. Really disappointing. Food tasted meh... $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there... Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh... Gyoza tasted bad...
author: Jessie K.

description:
Came in during the Cherry Blossom Fest

Didn't acknowledge us when we came in, then saw the hostess/waitress standing by s table toward the back "waiting" for us. Forgot about giving us menus, had to go to counter for them. Aside from taking and bringing out our order, we were never checked on. No hello, no goodbye. Food was meh, worse Inari I've ever had...super bland. Between food n service def won't go back.
author: Michael S.

description:
Why can't we put a 1.5 star? When you look at this place outside it looks not so bad. Maybe because the other decent restaurants make this dinky looking place presentable. 

Okay sushi chef sensei, you don't have the yell at your servers to let them know you have customers waiting. They have eyes, they can see us. 

The sushi is decent. It's average. If you compared this place with Osaka on Castro, it's pretty much the same. Although this place has over 500 different special rolls. I don't care how you name them, they pretty much taste the same no matter which way you the avocado slice on. 

The middle of the restaurant looks like a death trap because the tables are sooooo close to each other, and thanks for the leaving the back door open behind my back on a cold night.
author: Vinson H.

description: The older female server was being extremely rude. We stayed for 5 minutes and left because she was giving us attitude for no reason and kept rolling her eyes.
author: Ayumi Y.

description:
Yum! Quick lunch stop a few days ago while in San Fran, Japantown.

Delicious food and very, very good prompt service! I could easily make this place a regular if I lived nearby.

They got it right!
author: Tones T.

description:
Positives:

*Fresh raw fish and delicious rolls
*Good service that's always attentive and nice
*Good ambiance with nice seating, interior decors
* Old Japanese Men working as sushi chef (beside one)

Negatives:

*Always a wait
*Very small and cramp seating

I've been here a handful of times. Loved all their plates and sushi. It is always good quality. I don't know if I want to come at a busy time though. There's always a wait, but it can take 1-2 hours if you come on a weekend or peak hours. The seating is a bit tight, so when people or the servers walk around, it's a little uncomfortable. Overall good place.
author: Lily V.

description: Stayed overnight in Japantown and this place was recommended. The mammoth roll was absolutely wonderful!! I could go back and order just that! The poke that is served on top was delicious! Highly recommend.  Great, fast and friendly service too.
author: Malia R.

description: Not great, not terrible, just average. The service was pretty fast, but also felt a little rushed. It was nice that we each got a salad and soup even though we just ordered a few rolls to share. The fish on the rolls were of varying quality, but overall it was not bad. The problem was the portions for the sushi rolls were a pretty small - even though there were plenty of pieces, each piece was like the size of a quarter. Sushi for ants, as my friend said. We did see someone order the flaming dragon roll, which looked pretty impressive, but other than that, we'd probably opt for something different the next time we're in Japantown.
author: Wayne H.

description:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!
author: Joy G.

description:
My friend and I showed up at dinner hour on a weekday. There weren't very many people in the restaurant, so it was pretty quiet. The menu is so extensive, so it took us a while to choose what we wanted - way to many sushi variations for when you're so hungry. The service here was really weird. Everything was so rushed. The server came over to our table a number of times while we were trying to decide and it just got kind of annoying. We'll tell you when we tell you. Please relax. 

I ordered a Mexican Roll and a spicy tuna roll. The Mexican roll was actually pretty good. It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp. The spicy tuna roll was weird. Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before. I think they overdid it with the amount of fish, too. 

The service was, again, very pushy. It seemed like they wanted us out of there and I couldn't understand why because there was barely anyone else in the restaurant. 

Overall, Kippu is pretty average in both food and just pretty weird in service. Hmm. I look forward to trying a bunch of the other sushi restaurants in Japantown. This ended up being a pretty mediocre intro to the area.
author: Priti K.

description:
Everyone is aware sushi in Japantown is a total joke right? I would never eat here in a million years if I had the choice but my grandma lives across the street and our options are limited within walking distance. 

Decided to give this place a try since its one of the few places I haven't gone to yet and it was one of the worst. Service is SO FUCKING SLOW. There is one woman working and it seriously seems like you are bothering her by asking her for water since she hasn't refilled your glass once in the 90 degree humid as fuck space imitating as a Japanese restaurant. The other reviewers aren't kidding when they say its hot in here. There was a small fan at our table we couldn't figure out how to turn on and when I asked the waitress if she could turn it on for us she just looked at us and said we could do it ourselves. Um what. 

I ordered a california roll and a scallop lovers roll. Keeping up with their theme, the California roll came super hot! WHY IS IT HOT! The Scallop lovers roll which was supposed to be baked was hardly so and the mayo sauce on top was so gross. Oh god. Why. I saw they had toro on sale for $15 but I would never trust a place like this for their toro. 

Avoid at all costs plz. Japantown has yet to cease to fail me.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Walk over to Daiso and get a $1.50 Asian cowboy hat. Now you're ready to eat at Kippu, with its country-western music that enveloped the first 10-15 minutes of my visit before 180'ing to Kpop.

The miso soup smelled like one thing and one thing only: when I was little, I had a He-Man playset of a claw trap to catch foes and punish them with green slime pouring overhead - THAT. I didn't have to nasally investigate or reminisce either. The split-second the soup bowl hit the table, that smell came all the way back from the 80s right then and there. After deliberation, I eventually took a reluctant benefit-of-the-doubt sip. I shouldn't have.

Take time to pore over the creative and often lawsuit-inviting names of all the sushi rolls. "Chuck Noris" [sic], "Finding Nemo", "Forrest Gump", "Monkey Brain", and maaaany more await you. There's even "Victoria's Secret". But in that case, where's "Agent Provocateur"? Or straight-up "Costco" (you know who you are).

Also, get the frequent flyer miles card. Once you & your new hat have $dined$ here 10 times, you get $10 off your next meal. You'll need it if your portions are like what I got for what I paid.

I'm going with just under 3 stars.

FYI: There are beer & sake bottles on display, but this place is so new that it currently has *no alcohol license*. Don't plan to take your 21st birthday entourage here just yet. (But when you do, text me.)
author: Dan B.

description:
What I get -
Tuna, salmon, hamachi rolls.

I live in japantown and have been to Kippu many times.  It's a great place to get some well made sushi rolls. They do the conventional stuff really well and that's mostly what I'm a fan of in my sushi.  The quality of the fish varies sometimes but the tuna, salmon and shrimp are always reliable.  Their rolls and nigiri are great.  Tried the octopus there but it was a bit tough.

I've usually had good experiences here except once where I had to get take out and they messed up my order - but then I probably shouldn't have got sushi to go.

Sake when you're with 2-4 people is a great addition since this place has intimate seating and is good for groups that size.
author: Rajat S.

description:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!
author: Sam F.

description: My husband and I love to get their hot sake and a vegetarian bento box before heading to the Sundance Theatre nearby.
author: Circadian R.

description: The sushis and bento boxes were pretty good. Biggest downfall is that some sushis took a long time for it to come out.
author: Julia H.

description:
Lunch special 5 PC nigiri and California roll
Salmon and tuna was fresh whereas the other nigiri had veins( poor cuts). For the $12.95, it was a good deal.
author: Daniel W.

description: Food was good and service was quick. My boyfriend ordered the Ferrari and the Sex and the City roll and loved it. He couldn't stop raving about it as we were eating. His rolls were delicious with just the right amount of spice. We also had the beef teriyaki,gyoza, tempura box and it was very yummy. It was better than average for sure. Thanks Japantown!
author: Laura D.

description:
FOOD:

I came here with a friend for lunch on a Friday and got the Banzai roll, which is deep fried shrimp, avocado, and cucumber with mamenori, which is like a yellow paper, wrapped on the outside. I wasn't too impressed, especially since the wrap covered any texture of the sushi.

SERVICE: 

It was pretty quiet when we entered, so we got a table by the window.

The servers were a bit quiet, but it was fine. They weren't particularly friendly, so we just ordered and paid after we finished. The overall experience was that we pretty much just ate our sushi and we were on our way.
author: Erika S.

description: I was there for a single order of toro (2 pieces of fatty tuna).  It tasted off and it was clearly previously frozen.  In fact, I even mentioned to the people I was eating with that it seemed frozen.  The sushi chef told me "don't eat here, it's a tourist trap."  I ate the same lunch and dinner as the people I was with; that evening I developed terrible gastrointestinal problems (I'll spare you the details) and I was sick for 3 days with food poisoning.  I called the restaurant and they hung up on me the first time, then the second time they said "no there's no problems, nobody complains" and "if you're sick, go to the hospital and send me proof and we will refund you."  I don't want to be refunded, I wanted them to not serve the sushi anymore.  I have never left a negative review of a restaurant until today.
author: Ameet N.

description:
We dined here after a relaxing spa excursion at Kabuki Springs. We had discovered this place in a Yelp search for Japanese restaurants. Once again, Yelpers steered us in the right direction!

This is some of the tastiest sushi and and udon around. The place is kind of tiny. And once you walk inside, you feel like you're actually in Tokyo, far removed from SF. 

Our group shared a bunch of sushi and salads. My favorite dishes were the Dynamite Roll (deep fried spicy tuna & avocado), the Spicy Killer (spicy tuna, cucumber covered w/ white tuna), and the Peppercorn Seared Tuna with garlic sauce. Dinner started with a generous bowl of miso - which is a great palate opener. While I had a relatively small helping of food (due to an all-day tummy ache), my dining companions went to town with the Udon (heart bowls of soup filled with your choice of chicken, meat, pork, and veggies, and thick noodles). Everyone raved about their selection. So I'll need to come back again to taste it for myself.

One small warning - contrary to their website, Kippu no longer serves ramen. So if you're in the mood for ramen, you'll have to go somewhere else.

All in all, Kippu was a lovely Japantown discovery. I think I'll probably return here the next time I see a movie at the Sundance Kabuki Theater.
author: Kevin B.

description:
As mentioned in my previous review, the bento boxes are some of the cheapest I've seen, two items for less than $10 is a really good lunch deal.  

I hate to give 2 stars, but I had to write about a recent trip there. The 2 stars is not for the food but a bad experience with one of the staff.  My Bro ordered Katsudon and his  lunch came in a bento box.  "Hold on, we did not order a bento" So we told the person who took our order and he quickly took it away and apologized for putting it on the wrong table.  After 10 mins it came, we thought nothing of it since it did have a fried pork, so my brother ate some and then he remembered, wheres the egg with the pork???  By now we had all finished our lunch and we queried it with the server and we asked him, where was the egg???AGAIN!!! it was the wrong order and the server took it away.  We watied for an answer and by then the meter for our parking was almost up.  We politely asked for the bill and to cancel the order.  A very rude lady came to our table and said it was being cooked.  We asked her to cancel it and asked for the bill again.  A few minutes later, this lady came and practically threw the bill onto the table, which hit the edge an fell onto the seat.  My family was shocked at how rude she was, especially when she did not apologize for throwing the bill.  I think we would not feel so bad if she apologized.  And on our way out, our server apologized and all the staff behind the counter said goodbye.  If this lady continues to work there, I WILL NOT go back.  My 2 stars is not for the food but the bad attitude of this irate lady who threw our bill onto the table.  With attitude like that, you will loose customers.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Had a great meal with a group of nine that included five children.  We were attended to quickly and with a smile.  Drinks came very quickly when ordered, and once we ordered, miso soup followed immediately and the food came quickly soon after.
The food was FABULOUS!  Most of us ordered sushi rolls of different types, including two of the famous flaming dragon rolls (which truly were as delicious as they were exciting!).  Two in our party got dinner bento boxes which were extremely generous in portion size.

We'd highly recommend this small unassuming restaurant in Japantown!
--Girl Scout Troop 111, in town for the Golden Gate bridging ceremony during the first weekend of May.
author: Chantal F.

description:
I had an awful experience here with my friend.  The food literally made me sick.

My friend I arrived at 9:20pm, which seemed like plenty of time given that the restaurant allegedly closes at 10:00pm.  With in two seconds of seating we were told to order within the next five minutes because the kitchen was closing.  Ok.  A minute later the waitress was back demanding our order.  It is a large menu and we did not even have time to read it.

Then we ordered.  The waitress talked my friend into ordering two rolls that basically were fried California rolls.  I had not even read half the menu, so I asked the waitress for a recommendation.  At her suggestion, I ordered one roll, something with spicy tuna.  And, of course the waitress pushed me to order more.  Based upon the photos and high price, I thought one roll was sufficient.  But, the waitress insisted otherwise and further pressured that the kitchen was now closed -- it was only 9:22pm.  So, I also ordered a spicy tuna hand roll and croquets. 

Well they must have had items pre-made because the next thing we knew they were throwing food on the table and taking it away faster than we could eat it.  The waitress failed toe toon that everything comes with miso soup and salad.  When they both unexpectedly arrived, we officially knew we were swindled into ordering too much food.  

The spicy tuna hand roll was nothing to write home about and a bit fishy.  The moment I took the last bite the waitress, knowing I had another roll coming, swiped my plate, ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.  Then set down the croquets which were average.  As soon as the croquets cooled they were disgusting and they got cold fast.  

Then the rolls came.  My friend's rolls were average fried and expensive California rolls that were made with fake crab at real crab prices.  She was upset because the waitress clearly pushed her to over order as well and the once the rolls cooled off they were gross.  Again, my roll had fake crab and spicy tuna. It tasted worse than a cheap roll from the grocery store and cost $16.  It was not fresh or worth the price charged.  In fact, I asked for a beer to wash it down and didn't finish it.

The service was so rude.  They started putting chairs up on tables around us at 9:30pm.  This is inappropriate because the restaurant is open until 10:00pm and, more importantly, there were guests still waiting for food.  We left well before 10:00pm and the lights were off and the staff was walking out too -- seriously change your hours to reflect the restaurants actual closing time.   If the rushed service, bad service, and fact that the restaurant closed before completing its food service wasn't bad enough, our waitress was not friendly and purposely oversold us on food.  Maybe that works with tourists, but we live here and expect a more honest approach.

To make matters worse, by the time I got home, I was violently ill.  I think it was the fishy tuna.  Let's just say it was a long and unpleasant night of my body physically ejecting what I ate there.  Miserable.  I think it had to be the fishy tuna because my friend did not feel well, but was not violently ill.

Maybe it was an off night for this place, but either way they got me really sick and that is really not ok.
author: Kiki I.

description: Get the flaming dragon roll!  Not only does it taste amazing it comes with a show!   The service was quick and friendly. The wait staff worked together to take care of us. They were fairly busy but the food came quickly and it was all wonderful. Fresh fish in the sushi,  crispy tempura,  great sauce on the salmon teriyaki. A must try restaurant if you're in Japan town!
author: Megan R.

description: Had the pork katsu don because I have been craving it ever since I got back from Japan.  It wasn't horrible but I'm sure it could have been better.  Prices were comparable to the other restaurants.  The pork was not tender, it seemed as though it was cooked then microwaved before serving...leaving the pork pieces a little tough.
