I liked that they put veggies with the egg.  Other than that, nothing great.  Service was also a little slow however they were very friendly.  I don't know why that day I went to Japantown for Japanese food when all the really delicious spots are outside of Japantown.
author: Anh N.

description: Originally went to the restaurant next door and got a weird vibe so we came here. First let me tell you that the service is unbelievable. We were welcome with a bowl of soup and salad and our appetizers of seared tuna and dumplings were on point. We shared a flaming dragon and it was AMAZING! I'm shocked it has 3 stars. Our favorite places are unexpected surprises and this was one of them! This place is well beyond average.
author: Joseph G.

description: From the moment we entered the woman working was rude and cold. This is not a child friendly place, even with well behaved children. Our 22month old was just reaching her hands around and she quickly yanked the menu from her. She  was irritated we brought a stroller in, despite it being placed out of the way in the corner. We then decided to get the food to go because her attitude was more than I could continue to sit through. The place is also cramped and warm. The food was ok. Nothing spectacular.
author: Elise G.

description:
I went here for dinner. I ordered the tempura udon. I liked that they kept the tempura on the side so it doesn't get soggy in the soup. The tempura was light and crispy. I didn't really find anything special with the noodles or the broth. The dish also came with a bowl of salad which was ok too. 

Service was a little slow. It took a long time for my food to come out but there was a lot of people in the restaurant.
author: Alexander L.

description: The service was quick especially since we came in during a dinner rush. I also appreciate the fact that they were attentive with everything if it was good or if we need anything.
author: Mark J.

description:
I'm. About. To. Barf. 

Oh San Francisco... The only place where you shouldn't go to any of its Asian enclaves (eg. Japantown, Chinatown, etc) to eat its food. 

See pictures. Unfortunately I couldn't take a photo of the gnats flying around.
author: Tom P.

description:
I am so sad as I write this... It's not worth taking off a star but omg... after all the times I've been here with my girlfriend (I only go here with her) we FINALLY ordered the flaming dragon for the first time (for me, I always fall on her alternative day where she ordered it previous and decided to take a break from it) AND THERE WAS NO FLAME.  The waiter came over with it wrapped in foil and I was thinking, "oh. is he going to light it now?" NOPE, NOT SIR. IT WAS DONE AND HE JUST UNWRAPPED IT.  I don't know if it was because of that, it didn't even taste that great to me.  VERY VERY Disappointed. 

Thank goodness I had ordered another roll.. I tried the delicious roll and it had a good taste and texture to it, so that made things a BIT better -- still doesn't make up for my flameless roll though. grrrrr
author: Lisa L.

description: Delicious, fresh, and insanely fast during my lunch break. My husband and I love sushi, and we were very impressed by the quality and taste of their fresh sashimi.
author: Anne-Michelle F.

description: Great service and received my to-go order quickly. I ordered the beef teryaki and california roll lunch combo. Food was pretty good.
author: Lydia H.

description:
Do not order toro here!!!! I regret not taking a photo of it, but it didn't look like toro to me when it came to our table. First of all, color and texture weren't like toro or any part of tuna. Secondly, it looked like it came out of paper shredder; they made diagonal cuts on the surface... What kind of sushi restaurant treat a piece of toro this way?? I was already suspicious even before tasting it. So we tasted it, and it tasted nothing like tuna. It kind of had Saba flavor but definitely not tuna. It also had this weird consistency; the center was harder than the surface. I realized the diagonal cuts were to hide this weird consistency which was so different from real toro. 

We asked our server if what we had was really tuna. She was not sure so she brought another server to our table. This person had a frowny face and stood by our table without saying anything. So I asked the question again, then she said, "it is fatty tuna, and there is nothing wrong with the fish." I asked for the proof that it is actually tuna, then she went to talk to a sushi chef, and then came back to our table, took our bill without saying anything, and came back with a new bill and put it down on the table without saying a word and left. We looked at the bill and found they took out "Toro $14.95" from our bill. 

I'm 99.5% sure that the fish we ate was "white tuna (oil fish/escolar)" which is nothing to do with tuna. It was very oily it made my stomach upset. 

The fact that they didn't have a proof or that they didn't try to explain why they can't bring a paperwork already says something. And there was no "I'm sorry we didn't meet your expectation" or "Thank you for coming." She said nothing to us and just left the bill on the table. 

I'm not going back there. I don't trust any of their food now. If you choose to go, avoid "toro."

It's so sad this restaurant is in Japantown because it really doesn't represent Japan. Please have some pride to be a sushi restaurant owner and don't lie about what you serve.
author: Mai L.

description:
Came on January 1st and they didnt even have chicken or udon (in their whole kitchen) and they were at half capacity yet we had to wait outside for 15 minutes.

I just didn't like the rudeness or lack of substitution for the chicken since my girlfriend doesn't eat beef.  They kinda threw the menu at us then said "no chicken okay bye"  Other people had waited 20 minutes to get food and got up to leave.  After looking around, everyone was disappointed so I just chose to leave instead of wait and then be disappointed. 

Seems like a trend that this place has terribad service... Judging from how much food was left on people's plates that had paid and left it probably doesnt taste very good either.
author: Anthony C.

description: Sushi was delicious, flavorful, and fresh! We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11). We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well. Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.
author: Shee X.

description:
Great, fast service.  Fantastic prices! Super friendly staff! 

Came in with my husband and 4 friends. Ordered a ton of food to share family style and it came out on a rolling basis immediately. Fish was super fresh. 

Good for smallish groups, medium noise level, $-$$ prices. 

Will visit again!
author: Alex H.

description:
Very underwhelming overall. 7 of us take a while looking through the menu and not once does the waitstaff inform us they are out of half the menu. As my friend said, how are you out of Donburi at a Japanese restaurant?? It's just rice and meat!

The nigiri was pretty ordinary although the bento boxes were pretty huge so there's that at least.

Another fiasco was splitting the check, they refused to spit the check and let us each add gratuity individually then brought back the check with gratuity added. Why not just add it to begin with? Not impressed.
author: Gonzalo S.

description: Walking through Japantown, we had high hopes for this small establishment. Never like to leave reviews this bad, but it was awful. The service was great which is why it isn't 1 star, but the food was disgusting and the wine selection just as bad. The complimentary miso tasted more like bad tap water than a soup.
author: Shaina B.

description: A great cosy little place with super friendly staff, and good food to boot! A great assortment of sushi from rolls to chirashi and sashimi. The food is always fast and tasty!!
author: Chris B.

description: Went to eat lunch here with my family. Service was ok, food wasn't good. Server checked on us alot, but didn't get us a coke that we ordered until the end of our meal (we had to ask again because she didn't even remember we ordered a coke), and it all felt rushed because she did everything quickly and spoke very fast. I ordered the Takoyaki and 4 Seasons roll. Ate 1 Takoyaki out of 5 and didn't finish my 4 Seasons because it made me a little nauseous. The scallops were raw (I hate raw fish/shellfish) normally when I order an item with scallops, they are cooked. Guess I just ordered the wrong item on the menu. I ate 2 leftover pieces from my brother's Spider roll, and it was again mediocre. Nothing special about this place, I left pretty hungry still. Won't be coming back.
author: Vy T.

description: My friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and our cravings for Japanese food were satisfied. The waiters were very welcoming and I'm impressed we got our food in less than ten minutes! The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable. Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy. The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends. Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.
author: Gene A.

description:
3.5-star food
2.8-star service

FOOD

Nigiri
Ono (super white tuna) was fantastic - thrilled to find it here as many sushi bars often don't have ono. Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi (eel). While the fish was fresh, the construction was sub-par - the fish kept separating from the rice. 

Skip the uni and roe (term) - these were mediocre.

Starters
Seaweed salad was excellent -  not too salty/sweet
Kaki fried (oysters): panko-breaded, tasty and plump

SERVICE
Sushi chef was pleasant, but otherwise service was non-existent. Server didn't check on us until nearly the end of our meal, which almost seemed like an afterthought. 

Pricing is reasonable.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: It was a Thursday afternoon, me and my friend were trying to look for a decent sushi place around Japantown and stumble across Kippu, so we decided to check it out. Came into the establishment and was seated right away, looked through the menus and the waitress comes over and asks us if we are ready to order. We weren't ready yet so we started off with two cokes. Once we were ready, we ordered 3 rolls, an appetizer and some miso soups. The miso soups were complimentary which was nice and we got the oysters, the mountain roll, the scallop bay roll and titanic. The first roll that came was the rainbow roll which wasn't what we ordered and so we let it sit there till our server came so we can tell her that it isn't what we ordered. Later on, she dropped off the titanic and scallop bay roll which was good and then later dropped off the mountain roll. Here's when things get a bit frustrating. She was the only server and she running around frustrated which I understood cause business started picking up but when she dropped off the mountain roll, I guess she didn't realize that it wasn't the mountain roll to begin with and it took her awhile to come check back with us. And we were patiently waiting, so patient to the point where we finished our first two rolls and our oysters that weren't even pleasant. Once she came, my friend and I were telling her that this isn't what we ordered and she tried to tell us that it was and we showed her the picture and she said, "it has this this and this" and then we pointed it out that it didn't have the certain toppings on it, so she asked us if we wanted those toppings on it and we said yes and she went and did that for us. I mean the issue wasn't about whose right and whose wrong but if you're gonna advertise something as this then don't bring it out something as something different you know? Overall cute little place, would I recommend this place to anyone? Eh, I don't think so.
author: Chantille T.

description: Went here with a group of friends when visiting one of our SF buddies. The sushi was really good -- fresh, reasonably priced, tasty! I have recommended this place to sushi aficionados venturing near Japan Town. Seating can be a little cramped so this isn't the best venue for big groups, but with small groups of friends it's a very intimate, lovely setting.
author: Megan M.

description:
We came on a Thursday night. Most of the tables were occupied, but due to the good size we had no trouble being seated.
The sushi is fresh and the service courteous.  
We ordered salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi. The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.
author: Natascha G.

description: Taste wise, there is nothing wrong with the food.  Be prepare to pay a high price.   I guess this is common for Japanese food.
author: S L.

description: Killing time around Japantown and feeling a bit peckish... I came across this little gem.  Even though the lunch hour was "over", their "specials sign" drew me in.  Chicken Bento Box for $6.50... I was pleasantly greeted by the server.  The restaurant is small and tidy but immaculate.  Only one other diner when I arrived, but i did hear them "oohing and aahhing" over their meal.  I was immediately given water and Miso soup, which I love.  The server explained the difference between the $6.50 BB special and the regular $8.50 BB, I went with the special and was very pleased.  Food was "Hot" and "Plentiful".  Great flavors.  Salad dressing is the Chef's Secret which I could not get out of my server, but I can say "I wanted the recipe". Shrimp and Fried Potato cooked perfectly, rice dusted with black sesame seeds, and Teriyaki Sauce not to sweet.  Just what I needed and just what I wanted and now I must return to try other specials on their menu. Great location for "before a movie @ Kabuki" or "after a movie".
author: Marla B.

description:
*Very cozy atmosphere.
*Good drink specials.
*Great menu variety.
-They do pack you in tightly.
-No chicken tempura when I went (my favorite).

This place was a stone throw from Hotel Tomo where we were staying so we checked it out. Very cozy atmosphere as you enter through the door and walk down a couple steps into a small restaurant. We chose this place because it seemed like the menu had the most variety out of the other places in the area. From tempura, to sushi, to bento box, udon, and teryaki and lots of other great selections. As far as a Japanese sushi restaurant in Japantown San Francisco this is as good as it gets and I think it's the best one in the area. 

=Great atmosphere is something that I would imagine you would find in Japan. Next time I find myself in San Fran I will return most likely.
author: Matt L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in Japantown. Good prices, yummy cuisine, and friendly staff. Very good vegetarian dishes as well!!
author: Justin N.

description:
This restaurant is conveniently located in the middle of Japantown in SF. 

I came here for lunch and ordered the lunch special bento box with sashimi and salmon teriyaki. My friend ordered the tonkatsu with California roll. I did not have high hopes for this restaurant (as Japanese restaurants in Japantown don't have the best food ironically). However, the salmon sashimi was pretty fresh and tasty; the salmon teriyaki was decent as well (a little overdone but the teriyaki sauce was flavorful and not overkill). The tonkatsu (Chicken katsu) was too dry making the meat too tough. 

Overall, I'd come back but the food is just okay and not worth a trip on its own.
author: Lillian C.

description:
I have been meaning to write this review for about a month now.  My friend's birthday was middle of September and we came here randomly, after wandering Japantown for a bit looking for a place to eat.

We had a big group of people (~10), and we ordered a lot of rolls, appetizers, drinks, bento boxes etc.  They handled it really well, and were SUPER friendly to all of us.  The food came out in stages of course, but they tried to make sure everyone had at least one of their dishes in the first round so that no one would be waiting and hungry. Everyone really enjoyed their food (and this was not just because we had been drinking sake...).  To top it all off, the waiters all sang very exuberantly to my friend for her bday, and brought her a dessert on the house which was big enough for literally everyone at the table to have some.  Yum!

The bill was really reasonable considering the beer & sake, all the food, and the great service.  It came to about $50pp, including paying for the bday girl and tipping well.

I would definitely consider bringing another large group here.  I can't believe our luck to come without a reservation, at 7pm on a Friday night, and still make it in with like a 5 minute wait (while they set up the table).  And the service really made the evening!  Our waiters were so friendly and our birthday girl really enjoyed getting the princess treatment!
author: Caroline K.

description: Horrible service. Extremely rude wait staff. The waitress was trying to pick a fight with us. She threw the menus at us and threw our utensils too. She kept rolling her eyes. We stayed for 5 minutes and left the establishment after we couldn't take the uncomfortable tension any longer. The chef didn't even apologize to us after we told him we were leaving. Close this place down, Kippu has no business being in the restaurant business
author: Jackie S.

description: Please do not go here, I got Food poisoning. Food wasn't good and the service suck so bad. They didn't bring water to us and we ask them twice no refills at all. They bought all our food very late and when all the food came in, one of my family members food dish didn't came in, until we all were finish with ours. This happen in the afternoon and there were not so many people, it was my family and two other family that was there. They had three waiter. After eating here I wasn't feeling well and threw up shortly after.  Please do not go here
author: Vickie X.

description: I had the best service and experience in this restaurant. Sushi is fresh and service is extremely quick.  The menu has pictures and the the variety is extensive.
author: Homar M.

description:
Stumbled on this place while being a tourist and wandering through Japantown.

Atmosphere was great - not too big, pretty private areas for seating in spite of being one big room.

Menu was great - lots of Nigiri Sushi options, special rolls and basic ones too. 

Great quality and volume of food for the prices.

Quality and volume of food was excellent - rolls were decent in size, very evenly diced tiny vegetables in vegetarian rolls, and extremely fresh. We only ordered a few small rolls and a hand roll and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it. The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.

Service was excellent and fast - rolls came out quickly, servers were attentive and answered questions about the different rolls.
author: Margot D.

description:
I came here a while back with my sister for the heck of it. I remember she ordered sushi, which was ok, nothing spectacular if my memory serves me right.

I had udon, the beef one I believe. It's probably the best udon I've had ever in my life. Everything about it was just perfect! The salad was delicious too. I keep on saying I want to go back just for that udon again and unfortunately I haven't been back since for whatever reasons.

The service was ok. We were seated fairly quickly, but the servers never really checked on us. They kept on checking the other customers. They probably only came to check on us once. I didn't really mind though since we got to eat in peace.

Not a good place to talk loudly though as I remember it was pretty quiet in there.
author: Krystal C.

description: 1 star for horrible service. Stopped by around 4 pm because my little boy was hungry. Ordered a bowl of udon for him as rest of family not hungry. Manager was enraged when she discovered that we were ordering only one bowl of udon. She roared, "ONLY ONE???!!!!" and angrily removed rest of the utensils. She sat at cashier station giving me the stink eye the entire time we were there. The restaurant was practically empty with only 2 other tables occupied. I'm sure she would have preferred that we all ordered food, but I'm not aware of a rule that every single customer must order. I don't profess to have much knowledge about the restaurant industry, but I would assume any bit of revenue is better than none. In any case, I've never been treated in such a rude and hostile manner at a restaurant before.
author: Cantona E.

description:
Came here for tonkotsu ramen (not tonkatsu which is pork cutlet). Tonkotsu is a painstakingly difficult to make ramen broth. It's made by cooking pork & chicken bone, along with other per-house ingredients, for a long time. Like 1-4 days!

Kippu's tonkotsu ramen broth was really really good. Surprisingly good. My guess is it's a 2 day tonkotsu. It's rich and seasoned nicely. The size and shape of the bowl was very authentic, enormous.

So why 3/5? The details...

* The egg was hardboiled and plain, instead of softboiled & marinated (ajitsuke hanjyuku)
* The chashu pork was tough, dry. Not belly.
* The wakame seaweed was clearly instant.
* The noodles were so-so not hand-made. 
* Tea was served chinese style, in an entire pot.
* The draft beer was flat.
* The staff was entirely korean.

I want to say I'd come back but the truth is the devil is in the details and even though Kippu has damn good tonkotsu broth they fell short in too many areas. Damn.

To Kippu: Use the following recipe to rescue your horribly dry eggs :) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=baRJaOiNpmU
author: Grayson K.

description: Nicely priced. The sushi is good,  and dinner bento box is filling.   People are moderately friendly.  Hot sake for cold days, and a warm atmosphere.  This is a decent place for food.
author: Matt W.

description: Just ate here for lunch. Please save yourself and don't go here. The food is awful. The sushi is warm and flavorless. The environment seemed clean but they played American top pop hits and anime fighting music blasting...like it was a club. I wish I chose to eat at another restaurant close by...but I went to this one because it was open (3pm ish)
author: Lauren R.

description:
I agree all the negative reviews about this place.. I have been a loyal customer for a long time and I want to point something very dangerous about their food serving lately..
As I was eating my food my wife noticed the chicken surfaced half pink and God knows what could happen if she didn't tell me..  
1- The California roll was very good.
2-Their side salad was very fresh and tasty.
3-Their server seems nice,but they don't clean your table special when going back to their kitchen with  their hand empty and they don't know how to run the floor.
4-My wife got her food and mine dish came 25 minute after she eat half hers....
author: Pedro D.

description: My daughter and I had a quick lunch here today. The food was great and the service was excellent. I had a King's roll, she had a crunchy roll. They weren't serving Beto boxes, maybe due to the Presidents' Day holiday.
author: Noah C.

description: Love this place's SAKE! Sake is salmon nigiri. They use best part of salmon to make the nigiri. Very time I came here I will order at least 3 orders sake, if I came with friends, we may order more than 6orders. Service are friendly and helpful! Definitely will come back and this is the best Japanese food in sf!
author: Cyan C.

description:
Warm, lively greeting by the sushi chefs.  Great, kind, attentive service.  I absolutely loved the variety of specialty rolls.  We ordered the Washington, Crazy, and Love rolls and all were great, but the Crazy was a little bland (yellowtail, tuna AND salmon overpowered the veggies).  Always a plus to get complimentary soup and salad with a maki order.  The tea was nice, but luke-warm, not piping hot.

Over all, a solid choice for sushi in Japantown.
author: Dave N.

description: We went there for late dinner. And our server Brian was awesome. He took good care of us. The food was delicious. We ordered tamago as appetizer and it was the best I've ever had. Lol. Their sushi tastes so fresh and good. Our waiter was really polite and he was also funny. Thank you Brian for your customer service . We will definitely be going there again.
author: Veronica G.

description: I was in a bad mood when I laid out my comments. It's really my go-to place for convenience and always open when other places closed for lunch. Good quality fish, good sake, I'm happy.
author: Mario A.

description:
Had the King Kong sushi - just enough spiciness, and full of flavor !
A long with the Chicken Udon- Very hearty, large dish. it was enough for dinner that night, and lunch the next day !! it was just exploding with vegetables, shrimp tempura, chicken, fish cake, and egg. so much going on there, i was really impressed with the soup. will be back for more !!!!!!
author: Lena E.

description:
It's always an adventure when I travel to the city. When ever I go, I either get lost trying to go somewhere or try a new place with good ratings on yelp. This time it was both.

Not knowing where we were, my friend and I decided to park near what we hoped was Japantown to find a place to eat. This was the very first place we stumbled upon and after a short hesitation we decided to give 'er a try (I lived in OK, sorry). 

Anyway, we walked in and it wasn't hard to tell they were swamped with customers. Loud screams and shouts telling us where to sit came from what seemed to be the owner of the restaurant. (which didn't really bother me)

But we sat at the bar and looked through the menu while an older, drunk Japanese couple left the bar and dumped a $60 tip into the chefs jar. With that, my expectations rose.

We ordered an Orange Blossom, Victoria Secret roll, a bento and an 18 piece shashimi combo- which all was individually cheap compared to other sushi restaurants I've been to.

Sadly the food took over 30 minutes to get to us- and I was afraid the waiter who tended us was swamped and forgot to give the chefs our order. But after maintaining some patience we finally received our food which made up for it's wait.

Everything was incredibly fresh which surprised me being that all of it was so cheap.

The rolls were very tasty- and I was sad when it was over.

The tempura on the bento was cooked to near perfection (some of the best tempura I've had in a while). And the noodles were awesome.

And lastly, we were given a complimentary salad from one of the chefs. I don't know if this was for the wait, just something the bar got, or just for a good tip. 

Well if it was for a tip, it worked- but of course the salad alone didn't do it. With the fresh, inexpensive food and the caring, entertaining chefs- (one almost stabbed the other and a hilarious conversation between them ensued)- I left this place full and satisfied. 

Maybe again some day when you guys aren't so busy!

3/5
author: Jordan T.

description: Good food bad service. Ive never had such bad service in a Japanese restaurant before. Keep in mind I do not have very high standards for service at all, I don't even mind if I have to ask for have my water glass to be refilled and such. But this was just abysmal. The miso soup didn't come with spoons, and we had to ask twice before they finally got us spoons, by the soup was already lukewarm. Then there was no soy sauce on the table so we had to ask for that. The food was good although average quality for the price. But then the waitress started walking to us asking if we wanted to order more food (what was the rush? I was literally 5 min into my entree), and when we said no, gave us the bill. Here's when the service went from meh to bad: the bill got in just 7 min into my entree (I was 40% done) and the waitress starting pressuring us to pay. What in the world? Then we reluctantly handed our credit card. They billed it and threw the signing tray on or table. Literally threw the bill with a *slap* onto the table. We were polite, reasonably dressed customers!! Uncalled for. And of course I was still only 75% into my entree, and the waitress rudely tapped on the bill and said "sign please". To which I replied "can you please wait for me to eat?". This is seriously the first time in years that I HAD to leave a bad tip. Disappointed. Regular service is really not that hard.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Great sushi. Amazing selection (dozens and dozens of roll options). They even have a good veggie section! Super fast service. They start you off with complementary miso soup and a salad. Been here a few times and have left sated and happy each time!
author: Dan F.

description: When I moved to SF (from LA) I thought the J-Town here would kick LA's Little Tokyo's butt!  Sadly, I was mistaken and left to choose from a sea of restaurants with mostly 3 star ratings.  I ordered the katsudon which was dried out and chewy. The water content from the eggs and onions leaked and made my rice soggy.  The flavor was alright, but nothing spectacular.  The saving grace was the cheap drink prices.  Although, the sake was kind of weak in flavor. Given some of the other options in J-Town, I think I'd come back for some cheap sake bombs and light snacks, but that's it.
author: Josh S.

description:
This was one of the worst experiences I have had in terms of service. We went at 4:30 one afternoon and with a party of 5 we were 1 of two tables in the restaurant with over 80% open tables otherwise. We first only ordered beers and sake and she immediately said we have to order food to be there. We said we were looking over the menu and she waited at the table for several minutes for an order. She finally went back to her stand and stared at us the entire time thereafter. She was so angry that we finally asked for the bill and left. On our way out she asked us never to return! In addition to the completely uncomfortable experience, the restaurant was overheating and the it smelled like old ware washing throughout the front. All the cups provided were sticky and the tables were not wiped entirely clean.  

I really recommend choosing another option in the area and avoiding this one. Aside from service I am concerned about cleanliness!
author: Casey C.

description: I've been avoiding this place since my last visit with the nasty  older  woman.So i decided to give this place another chance. The food is good nothing WOWEE !! The waitress was very nice. I'll go back if i don't see the older woman with the nasty attutude. I used to work in retail and food service and unless a customer was SUPER RUDE i was always professional and civilize so i don't get the attitude since i'm the one paying.PEACE!!
author: Jo K.

description:
We came here yesterday for lunch  and enjoyed it.

   We order lunch Box  .  Fish and Tempura which not bad at all.

    It's only about 8 dollars which also come with soup and salad.

   Great value .  But the service could be slow when they get busy.
author: Dom G.

description:
The service here is awful but the sushi is good. I went here with a friend and the waitress proceeded to seat and fill orders for three tables that came in after us.  They are very nice but cannot keep it together when it gets busy.

The food though is great and pretty reasonably priced. We didn't eat many rolls but any of them with sauce seemed to be swimming in it. Sashimi was very fresh and generous slices. I have actually been here twice and as long as you have a bit of time the food makes up for the service
author: Heather S.

description: I got the «chicken teriyaky + tempura + gyoza» combo for only 10,50$ it comes with a miso soup + salad + my bento combo. Big portions, I totally recommend it, I was full after that, good quality/price ! *no wifi / the staff is not japanese but much more like korean or chinese, one of the chef was mexican, Mario
author: Julien F.

description:
Miso Ramen - fail.

Spicy Juno Sushi - win.

Price - Bit more than what I had anticipated to pay.

Service - Waitresses did their job but with a "I don't want to be here" look on their face.

Verdict - pass.
author: Angela Y.

description:
Pretty god sushi really smooth taste, the spicy tuna and lower priced rolls are really cheap so stick with the higher rolls. They have some funky names and trendy stuff. For me I know what I want so just read what it is before you dive in. 

Come before 3pm and after 6pm I think the sushi chef is on break in between I came at 4pm and child the rice was loose like a goose....not fr 40 bucks not at all....but lunch is really good and the bento boxes are pretty tasty too.
author: Joi M.

description: Decent combo (salmon, tempura, gyoza). Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: Meh. Hungry and in a pinch it worked, but I don't think mustard ever has a place on sushi rolls. Atleast not how this roll was done. There was a plethora of 4 sauces...too much in my opinion.
author: Christine E.

description: Me and my friend came here the day before Valentine's day and we were seated right away. It was about 8pm at that time. They served us complimentary miso soup and salad. I'm not sure if it's always like that but they said it was free so yay for us! My friend got the Flaming Dragon and I got the 49ers. Didn't really like the smokey taste of the Flaming Dragon but you can never go wrong with a 49er roll. Service was great and will definitely be coming back here.
author: Lesley M.

description:
I cam here last night on a double date.  The place started off great as we were greated, seated quickly (the restaurant was maybe 30% full), and given waters.  Shortly after the waiter took our order.  We ordered two bowls of Udon while our friends ordered some sushi rolls.   

It took only about 5-10 minutes before all three sushi rolls were quickly expedited out and placed on the other side of the table in front of our friends.  As they began to eat, we continued to wonder where our Udon was.  (Udon should probably be ready in under 5 minutes- it might be the EASIEST Japanese dish to prepare in the back kitchen- broth, noodles).

After waiting nearly 15-20 minutes we asked if our food was on the way, only to be quickly shrugged off by the crappy waiter with the mohawk. 10 minutes later we decided to ask again with the same response, "its coming its coming... one minute".  About 45 minutes after our friends finished their last piece of VERY AVERAGE/ OVERPRICED sushi- I finally walked up to the front to cancel our dishes.  

(The same thing happened to the couple sitting next to us)

OVERALL- terrible experience.  This place has no clue on how to expedite a kitchen, or treat their customers.  I will not come back here ever again nor give one good recommendation.  Japan Town management should fine Kippu for a job terribly done.  Keep up the bad work, KIPPU.
author: ilya g.

description:
When my dad comes to town, this is where he always wants to stop by. 

I can't blame him; the service is great, and the food is too. 

For Japantown being...well, Japantown, the food here is a little disappointing. Many of the restaurants don't have a lot of choices when it comes to sushi. This place has pages, and pages of choices. It takes me ages to order. Decisions give me anxiety.
author: Raquel R.

description:
Watch your bill for overcharges! 
After showing staff the menu prices vs. the prices on the bill, the staff did not make the corrections.
author: Lord F.

description: Adequate sushi and rolls but  nothing outstanding.
author: Prescott B.

description: Ate here beginning of Nov. The fish and sea urchin were fantastic quality. Service was great. It was nicely clean and the seating layout is good. The quality to price is pretty good and I'm picky. So we had hand rolls, roe, sashimi, rolls and sea urchin, among a couple side dishes.
author: Gary S.

description:
Kippu was not bad, not bad.

Unfortunately for Kippu, their are 4-5 star places all around, so if people know the area, there's no reason to settle in an "okay" place.

Ordered a couple Bento boxes and some sushi.

Bento boxes were average portioned and priced fairly ($9-10?). 

The rolls were just okay, sorta falling apart. Chicken katsu was fine - nothing extraordinary. Teriyaki was also okay.

Sushi was mediocre and had I known this, may have pulled back on the raw ordering. (My rule of thumb: when in doubt, order cooked fish)

The Bento boxes and sushi took a bit more than 15 minutes to produce during a dead Thursday lunch period. There was only one other customer in the place.

As I said, it wasn't bad. Just not great. And certainly not memorable.
author: Jefferson S.

description:
My wife and I boycotted Miyako (former business name) due to the lack of professionalism, lazy sushi (meaning: no attempt of making dishes to taste, rather decided time management was more crucial) and absolute cold atmosphere.

We decided to try Kippu (being that it was advertised as new management) and see if we found a new sushi bar in our neighborhood.  

Unfortunately, the first impression was less than sub-par.  We sat for a longer time than we should have (I managed in the industry) and I eventually had to say "excuse me" to order drinks...on Valentines Day!?

The young lady who served us was less than attentive to us, but they may be due to the fact that they were understaffed (for a restaurant holiday) and very busy...I gave that fact a lot of slack and I understand how that is...So, I was patient.

I ordered my dish and when I recieved the dish, I thought it was a mistake...well, it was...it was mine.  I ordered Nigiri rather than Sashimi (don't ask...)

I asked the Sushi chef (who was slammed and I couldn't even converse with him) if I could just exchange ONE of the fish for another, I hadn't touched it and I really was hoping for that particular fish.  The young lady approached me and said "Sorry Sir, once it's made we cannot change"  I replied "Really!?...you won't even hear what I have to say and make a slight adjustment?"  She says, "Let me get the manager". (or the decision maker, apparently)

I had to ask again later "who do I have to speak with?"  She puts this guy in front of her and say "him".  

To our delight, we meet Uugii.  I explain the situation to Uugii and let him know that it was my mistake and I will pay for what I ordered, but I would like to switch a slice if I could.  Uugii was so laid back about this request and had no problem in being accommodating.  Let me just say; this is where I will go back to Kippu just based on that.  Well done Uugii, but it doesn't stop there, more to follow...

The fish was tasty, fresh and the cuts were honest.  Not the warmest place, it almost felt like a Chinese or Russian restaurant, but Uugii changed all of that.

We left and were all the way around the corner on Sutter St., we hear a yell and someone running, I braced for a homeless guy to come asking for money or something to that effect...here comes Uugii with our V-Day cards that we had exchanged and forgot...Seriously?  These cards were just cards to them, but he made the run to make sure that we had our cards.  Not food, not a jacket...but cards.

My wife and I were pleasantly stunned and smiled the whole way home.

Good food, forgivable service and competitive pricing...after all that we experienced...WE WILL BE BACK!

Thank you Uugii.
author: Christos L.

description:
I and my friend ordered vegetarian bento box and Flaming Dragon. Flaming Dragon is lovely and taste great! But vegetarian bento is not great. Croquettes is the only good item in the box. Tempura vegetable is wet inside out and steak tofu is so bland. 

Other thing to add is about cleanness. It appeared that someone touched my napkin because there was a wet crease on it. When my server served ice water, I see oil on the surface. And my plate was still wet that I can see huge drop of water rolling in it. So be aware of that and be careful before start your meal. 

I still gives three star because sushi is great. Servers are nice. But too many thing they might overlook.
author: Chalisa B.

description: First official review for me...awesome. Ok so let me start with my family is friends with the owner here but that won't stop me from writing an honest review. The location is conveniently right off the street and its nestled in a cute corner like location. The place is clean and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome even before they knew that we knew the owner. Overall the food was pretty good and everything tasted fresh. We ordered everything from nigiri, sashimi, hwe dub bap (Korean style sushi bowl) and dessert. Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone. We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare but I was happy to receive it in any case. We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good. The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks. Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars. I will return.
author: Guisela L.

description: I stopped in with some friends before a night of karaoke. The service was really slow to almost non-existent. The sushi and food was very sub par. I really wish we had dined elsewhere in the area.
author: Wayne H.

description: Very fresh sushi. Lots of different rolls to choose from. Fun and friendly atmosphere. Highly recommend!
author: Chris E.

description: We're visiting from Washington and was really looking forward to good service and sushi.  But the lady and Guy suck!!! Lady was super mean and wanted to close the restaurant more than wanting to help us. We asked for water 10x before we got it.  The young boy was so busy and she didn't want to service anyone but focused on closing the restaurant. 0 stars not worth it. Sushi was alright.
author: Zac T.

description: We were given a friendly greeting and our party was seated right away. Our appetizers were fresh and came out quickly. The miso soup was great and the salad was fantastic! Two of our party had sushi and both enjoyed their dishes. The rest of us had tempura and teriyaki.  The portions were large and the meals tasted just right. I just took off one star because we all thought our martinis were weak.
author: C A.

description: So i came here because my friends told me about this place. I felt like they didnt feel comfortable with me there. They sat my right infront and huddled around me until i ordered. They basically stood there while i ate then rushed me out the door. I havent been treated like that ever and i wish i had a better experience because the sushi was amazing. I guess being a black woman warrents shitty service. I have money people. You should've treat me like some homeless person who would run after eating.im never gonna go back and ill let as many people know how they treat their non asian customers
author: Silken B.

description:
Don't order the chewy beef aka beef teriyaki.   

Washington roll is good if you're in the mood for salmon

everything else is really okay... kinda typical fare.  nothing special.
author: Regi K.

description:
-It was good, fresh, fish.
-The miso was not only delicious but it was visually entertaining.
-The lunchbox was very filling
-The atmosphere was a quaint place with a small bar area.

Over a 4 star experience!
author: Seth L.

description:
I was in the area and craving sushi, tried the Ono (white fish) nigiri and the flaming dragon.  Both were fishy even after the one was set on fire.  I felt sick and did not eat more than one bite of either.  Waste of $20 and either I was there on a non-fresh fish day or other people have no sense of what fresh fish tastes like.
Oh and the staff was terrible, being not even close to half-way full and very inattentive.
author: Kim L.

description:
We played some sushi roulette during a recent conference and lucked out with a great lunch at Kippu.  Ordered up a bunch of rolls with some coworkers - and this place did not disappoint - especially the FLAMING DRAGON roll.  I thought setting a sushi roll on fire was going to be super gimmecky, but it was awesome from both a taste and experience perspective.

Everything we ate was fresh, tasty and served speedily during lunch time - if I find myself back in this part of town, I'll definitely be back!
author: Helen C.

description: This place is great! Awesome service, and tasty, tasty fresh sushi. Been here 3 times, always good.
author: Valentin D.

description:
My first time here. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food you get. My wife and I loved it. The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce. I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad. The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great. I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies. Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant. The waiter was nice. It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me. Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten. It was really that good. I wish I knew the names of the dishes but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order.. All in all I was pleased and very full. I guess portions depend on what you order. The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !
author: David S.

description: My new favorite sushi place in Japan town! Love it! The price is not high. Very tasty food. Sashimi is very fresh and they give very big pieces. The service is good too! Just go there and you will see what I mean!
author: Peach K.

description: I love a nice cozy restaurant. The service was excellent. I will come here again...when I am in Japantown for CAAMFEST
author: Ronald N.

description:
haven't been here forever but i guess it changed hands many times.

service was terrible, asked for a unagi roll and asked what was in it, she went and asked the chef and came back saying it's unagi and avocado.  she then bring over a unagi roll with crab in it even though she told me it only have unagi and avocado.  i said you told me it's unagi and avocado and she looked like that conversation never took place.  we also asked for the unagi sauce to be on the side and it showed up with unagi sauce all over the roll, soaked.  when i asked her, she was like, it's not me, it's the guy making the sushi.  see, i wrote here, sauce on the side.  he didn't do it, it's his fault.  i was like wtf.  who cares who fucked up, someone fucked up.  fix it!  but no, that offer was never made.

the food is horrible too.  i'll upload a picture of the lettuce that came with my soup later.
author: Frank N.

description:
I used to live in Japan and I wasn't sure if I would be able to find authentic ramen, even in Japan Town.  Well Kippu didn't disappoint!  They recommended their ramen as some of the best on the menu and I got the spicy ramen.  It was excellent.  The noodle and flavor were great. My friend also loved her ramen.

The service was good, too.

To whoever wrote the review complaining about the plain cold tofu - don't blame the restaurant.  That's how they serve it in Japan.  It's just plain cold tofu and you can add soy sauce if you like.  For people looking to try this restaurant, there are other more exciting appetizers on the menu, so if you don't like traditional Japanese cold tofu then order something else.

I would love to go back and try their katsu next time I'm in the area.
author: Bahia S.

description: Walking through the area on our way to a concert at the Fillmore we decided to walk into this little restaurant and give it a try. We were greeted with a complimentary bowl of miso soup which was tasty. Edamame is served cold which I prefer hot but it was ok. Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious. Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better. Overall great service, quick very nice staff and it was a pleasant find!
author: Dana W.

description: Ordered the sashimi combo 22pc & 9pc nigiri combo and etc ... Omfg ... It's  not FRESH !! Tuna look brown color another fish look oily and soften ....after I ate this nasty meal And I decided to check out on yelp. They all are right . Only good here is the MISO soup then everything go downhill. This is the worst Japanese restaurant I ate in the city. Hope this review can help out other people to save their money in wallet. And hope I don't have diarrhea tonight
author: Kevin K.

description:
Some reviewers say the food here makes up for the bad service, but to me, neither the rolls nor the teriyaki was good enough to do that. And Yes the service was under.

My salmon teriyaki came out undercooked. They were nice enough to make me a new plate. However, the new plate came out with less salmon on it. I don't even know what to say about that
author: Alan T.

description:
My favorite sushi and sashimi place in SF!  These guys mean business when they make their sushi. Everything you'll order here is fresh, tasty and will be presented like you've never seen before.

I've eaten tons of sushi in the past, but ever since I've had a taste of their sushi, I keep coming back for more. They have lots of different kinds and tastes of raw fish and vegetables and their presentation skills are awesome. No plastic bento boxes here, only a true piece of art and good food!
author: Nicolas S.

description: Started with asking the waiter the same question twice and he just stared at me. Then came the food. Salty miso soup, heavily battered tempura, 3 pieces of salmon sashimi and chicken teriyaki. Lots of mediocre food. Won't be back.
author: James P.

description: Three Stars??? This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!
author: Rafael C.

description:
I'm no expert on Japanese food by any stretch of the imagination. But we were in Japan Town a few weeks back and went to another restaurant that was "award winning" and all that jazz. I was not impressed. The prices were too high, service was lacking and the food was just okay. The next trip we tried this place, mostly because it was a little off the path and there were no lines. So we decided to try this place and I'm glad we did! 

The first trip I had the teriyaki beef. It was very tasty! The soup was great as well, I'm usually not a fan of miso soup at all but theirs was different than most. Had to put two ice cubes in it to cool it down but the taste was great. The sushi (not a fan of sushi and I have no idea what was ordered) was good as well. The salad that came with lunch was tasty and the dressing was just right. 

Today I had the spicy chicken lunch. The chicken was GOOD! Just spicy enough to have a bite but not to the point where it tasted like burning. Service was great and food came out fast.

Pros:
Price. It's not a bargain meal but the prices are still really fair. Where else can you get a great meal like this for 6-8 bucks?  

Food. Everything I've had has been great so far!

Service. Can't really complain, friendly and efficient. 

Location. Right across from the touristy places and less tourist =D.

Cons.... Um.... having to ask for a fork! LOL yeah, I'm one of those kind of people.
author: Brad H.

description: Great atmos.  The menu is wrong, but that's ok because the waitress will tell you what it means and she is nice. Great Hat Sake.  Sake also means salmon.  Sake can also mean tuna.  They really want a quick giving and taking of the check transaction even if you want dessert.  But if you don't want an ice cream, you won't want dessert anyways, right?  There could be curtains dividing all the tables along the walls so each group could engage in secret activities, but they chose to take those curtains down it seems.  I didn't use the bathroom, but I bet it smells a lot better than the bathrooms at the Apple cupertino headquarters in beijing, cupertino because those smelled like poop.
author: Michael H.

description:
This place seemed to have changed hands at least twice in recent years. Now, I'd say this could be my new go-to destination if I crave for ordering sashimi combo in Japantown (versus regular sushi over rice for which I will still go to Isobune). Their sashimi combo plate was good for the price, and the fish was quite good in taste and quality in my opinion. Also, this is the one place I'm aware of in Japantown that serves a plate of raw oyster with the ponzu sauce that I enjoy, at the price of four pieces for $6.99 as i recall. It's about higher than, say, some restaurants in the Sunset but still price is satisfactory for fulfilling the crave for oysters.

Service is overall good. They show signs of potentially being disorganized when busy. For example, the waitress forgot to bring me a new napkin after promising to do so after seeing mine fell on the floor. No big deal. In fact, I'd say I like admiring one of the ladies to me was cute, the one that's more petite that was working there this past Monday night when I ate there. ;)
author: H K.

description: Pitchers for only $12 lured me through the door, Flaming Dragon and Ferrari Roll are worth trying....
author: Mar E.

description:
I want to like this place. It's close by and the first time I went was for lunch and the donkatsu was pretty good and service was fine.

I went again recently for dinner and the overall experience was terrible. Hey, restaurants get swamped and honest mistakes are bound to happen. The kicker was the manner in which they handled what they knew was a terrible dining experience for a customer.

1) Walked in and got a seat at the sushi bar. About 10 minutes passed when an older lady asked if I had already ordered. I told them I didn't even get a menu.

2) Ordered a spicy tuna hand roll, which came out promptly but with no wasabi. 

3) At the same time, also ordered a tempura cold soba. And waited.

4) And waited some more. After about 30 mins, one of the guy workers asked what else am I waiting for and I told him the zaru soba with tempura. He yells it into the kitchen. Tempura comes out 10 minutes later. Soba comes out another 5 minutes later.  They tasted decent.

6) Another 10 mins pass,and  an older worker (maybe the owner?) apologizes for the long wait and gives me a side salad that is supposed to come with the soba dinner set. 

7) Side salad has a jagged sharp piece of plastic over an inch long in there which did go in my mouth. I mention it to one of the waitresses who gives it to the guy at the cashier's area...who just seemed to bury the evidence without a care (throw in the trash and pretend it didn't happen). I told the waitress to give my check and inform the older lady (owner?). She does and the lady comes over and just looks kind of surprised and flustered but unapologetic.  No mention of anything to make up for the bad experience. I promptly left. 

Normally, I try to base the review mostly on food taste and minimally on service unless it's a fine restaurant. And maybe it was a one-off but it's pretty hard to be a fan of the restaurant after that experience. I certainly didn't expect to be there for almost an hour for just a cold soba with tempura and a hand roll.
author: Bern H.

description:
I'm surprised this place doesn't have more reviews! We've passed by countless times, including during the Cherry Blossom Festival where it was right in the middle of the madness and appeared to be packed.

When the Jazz Fest proved too crazy/packed, we headed over to Japantown for dinner. I couldn't resist the 14 piece sashimi chef selection, and it was SO worth it! The sashimi pieces were huge. I will definitely be back, this restaurant is a great value for your money.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Terrible service. I had to ask for a menu several times. I ended up getting up to look around the cashier's desk for menus, but apparently they had run out of menus.  Later on, I definitely kept getting attitude from one of the waitresses. Lots of curt responses. I almost felt like I was being scolded. Maybe it is an accent thing.

I ordered the Chirashi, which wasn't that fresh, but it did have very generous large cuts of fish.  (They chose quantity over quality.)  Sushi rice had excellent flavor (rice wine vinegar) and temperature.
author: Jeanne L.

description: I think the variety and innovation demonstrated by the menu makes this place a winner. I was sold the first time I had the flaming dragon roll. It's one of a kind and absolutely delicious.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place was horrible. The waitress was not attentive at all, and the food had no flavor. They couldn't get the order right after 2 attempts and didn't even start half of our order until we were ready to leave. I'll never eat there again, $50 for 2 people w/ crappy service!? Just a bad experience all around.
author: Paul S.

description:
This place certainly isn't bad, but there's no way I could say it was good either. I was hoping for some quality Sushi, but all I got was some pretty run of the mill sushi place. If you like commercialized sushi, this place is exactly what you'd expect. Their green tea was mediocre just like the restaurant, and set a proper tone for the restaurant's expectations.

The service was a bit slow and the guy that appeared to be the owner constantly barked commands at the girl that was working the restaurant as opposed to doing things somewhat  gently. A simple request for a spoon from him yielded a barked command from him to her which then she went into the kitchen to get me a spoon instead of him just giving me one.

Overall, I just wanted to stop here for a some-what-authentic meal and got a more 'meh' meal than what I could get down the street.
author: Anshel S.

description: This was my first time eating at this restaurant and I didn't know what to order because there were so many to choose. Out server named Bryan helped us out with what to order and they were all delicious! The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far! The service was great and food was great! The waiter was really cute too =D. Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!! Highly recommended!
author: Janice H.

description: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!  The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.  Miso soup was good too.  Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...
author: Carla L.

description:
My girlfriend, sister and I visited Kippu for Lunch during the Cherry Blossom Fest, and there was a bit of a wait, which was standard since the Festival is very popular. Upon being seated, we all ordered their Lunch Bentos. Nothing spectacular about their food. Just your average Miso Soup, Tempura and Saba Shioyaki for me. Had I known that there was a food court for the Cherry Blossom Festival a few streets down, I probably would've saved my money and visited one of the food stands.
Sadly, this restaurant, much like many of the Japanese restaurants around Japantown, is very mediocre. Which is a big disappointment to me, since one would expect Japantown to house the best Japanese Restaurants in the area. My recommendation: save up your money and try Wayo Sushi, off of Van Ness Ave. in SF. They're a bit pricy, and the restaurant is very small, but their Nigiris are the best I've had so far.
author: George T.

description: Just had perfectly fresh hamachi sashimi here. Kippu is always fresh, always has quick, courteous service and always gives generous portions. Our favorite sushi place in San Fran. Should have 5 stars.
author: Harrison K.

description: Flaming Dragon and reasonable prices rock!  The scallop roll......everything were beyond belief good.  The place is pretty busy.  Low key. The sushi chefs are super fast and nice. We happened to wander in during the Cherry Blossom Fest so it was super busy. They were very fast, delicious and had great prices.  Unusual rolls. Can't remember all of them.  Totally different and unique.  Love this place!!!!!
author: Elisa B.

description:
I got the beef teriyaki lunch special. It was yummy and I had a good amount of food. 

The beef was little tough, so if you prefer meat not to be well done, I advise you to request it to your likings because they didn't ask how you would like to have it. 

The customer service was fast and friendly. I got the check as I was eating. Rather than take it as a hint to leave, I appreciated the gesture since I hate waiting around for the check, especially since I go to Japantown during my lunch breaks and don't have time to waste.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Yummy, large portions, nice prices, and good service. They even gave us a free plate of edamame. The Spicy Miso Ramen   was good and different; a mix of Korean and Japanese flavor.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I really liked this restaurant! It was small and cozy, although it was a little too busy at the time we went, (we got there during the dinner rush hour.) The wait staff were quick and friendly but it did seem like they *almost* couldn't keep up with the tables, almost. I think it would have been perfect had we gone at a less busy time.
I ordered Bento box with Tempura which very good and not too oily, it came with miso, salad and avocado maki, inarizushi and rice, it was huge! 
My date got the pork bone ramen (i think thats what it was called)  and liked the broth very much but thought it could have had more veggies and meat, it came with salad and miso. 
For drinks we Kirin and Sapporo beer.
It was about $27 for the two of us including tip and drinks.
author: Diana C.

description:
I'd say it's more of a 3.5, but it may partially be due to the fact that it's quite convenient for us.  In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.  I've tried both the salmon and the beef teriyaki, all of which have been pretty tasty.  I'm also a fan of the tempura.  So definitely most of the stars are for this lunch special.  As for their sushi, it's not too bad.  Just don't let the pictures fool you; I once made that mistake and was disappointed with the portion size (it looked a lot more generous in the menu).

If it weren't so convenient, I would likely not go out of my way to eat here.  But still a great lunch deal!
author: Can C.

description: Absolutely awesome best sushi and most amazing date ever there love roll. Everything was great
author: Michael M.

description:
First time- Walked by on a whim and decided to give it a try.

I have to say customer service was good. Our waiter was attentive and took care of us well whenever we needed anything. Made some good recs.

We ordered the flaming dragon. Presentation was awesome. And the roll itself was good, the sauce made the roll. Victoria Secret had a awesome crunch to it. I would order 5 or 6 of those and eat way more. The Ferrari roll was okay. Melts in your mouth but nothing I would order again. Ordered dessert ... I kinda was expecting the mochi to be maybe bigger? Not something out of a trader joes box but that's just me. I could live without. We also ordered oyster shooters (I probably wont do that again) it tasted weird but only because I've never had one. The raw oysters were good. A bit spicy but tasted amazing. 

The price was also decent and cheap for SF sushi. I dont know about the music tho.. a bit too trancey for me. I'll be back for some more sushi tho. Tasted good and I'm already craving more Victoria Secret rolls!
author: Nathalie N.

description:
Hey another  1st for me....  lol..

While running through J - town in the city  with a couple of my boyz hunger settled in and we looking for a place to feed or faces....  As we looked around there it was right in front of us Kippu. It was about 2:00p.m. we found ourselves in a near deserted resturant.  Cool we should be able to get in and out as looked over the menu they served us tea and water. I walked over to the sushi bar and looked at the seafood and found it to be fresh.  As we ordered our server semed a little lost with what we ordering where he was looking at our menus and we were pointing to what we wanted. As our order came the broth to the was found to be rich and full of flavor with fresh noodles,  The short ribs were cooked perfctly and tender just melted in your mouth and te sushi was what i thought it would be fresh and clean. 

As we kicked back a bit we met Jeanie who was running the front as we talked we found out that they just opened and that the grand opening would be in a couple of weeks in which she invited us to come back and she asked about what we had thought....  This explained our server being unsure of the menu and repeating it a couple of times to us and when my boyz aked for forks it did a couple of request.

Over all the food was kickin the service was a little spotty.  4 stars for the food minus 1 for the server hopefully it will get better as it goes on.  Would we return? if in the City Yes we would make the trip from the 408 .....
author: Mark G.

description:
Lunch deals are amazing here.  For two, the bill came out to just over 15.  Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.  I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.  Simple, yet good - and excellent for the price!

Tuna sashimi was very fresh and sliced into three decent pieces.  California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.  Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!  Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.  Careful. 

I didn't attempt any of the rolls, but would definitely find my way back for a nice lunch under 10 dollars when I'm around Japantown.  That said, this is definitely not worth the trek or parking charges for a cheap lunch, unless you are already in the area.
author: Steph T.

description:
The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great! I have yet to try more things on the menu, but so far it has all been very good.

Side note: It was interesting to hear K-Pop circa 1998-2002 being played during lunch.
author: Anthony N.

description:
I am sorry, but definitely one of the worst sushi I have ever ate. I admit, it's hard to eat sushi in the lower price points and expect the same quality as places like Maruya in the city, but sometimes you just cant help but think, I rather pay more and get a little more in terms of satisfaction.

We ordered a few rolls (Double Salmon, Spicy Juno, Golden Gate, King's roll) and the agadashi tofu. I must say, I think the complimentary miso soup was the best part of the meal, as the soup came piping hot and was extremely flavorful, then it just all went downhill from there. There was absolutely nothing special about any of the rolls, and as hungry as I was, I literally only ate at most 3 pieces. The sushi was missing the fish quality and taste, but rather, each roll was just masked by either the flavor of spicy tuna and other sauces imbedded within. The rolls were fine, but the worst part of the entire meal was that agadashi tofu. WORST I've ever had and I didn't even know that was even possible? First of all, I was so disgusted by the texture, since to create that fried and soft exterior, Kippu used some type of starch that creates a thin clear layer of slime. Second of all, other than the nasty film of stuff, the taste was just not there and the tofu was more of a medium softness tofu rather than soft, which is what agadashi tofu is really supposed to be.

I was really disappointed, considering the fact that one of one co-workers suggested Kippu as one of her usual date night spots.

Although the service was spectacular, and the waiters were extremely attentive, I would surely not want to ever return here for another meal again. Apparently she told me that there's never a wait here though, and now I can completely understand why.
author: Luby H.

description: The sushi was great, but unfortunately the only thing they have for the rest of today is sushi rolls. NOTHING ELSE!
author: Andrew R.

description: The employees here are so nice. The prices are reasonable. The portions are generous. The service is quick. The food is delicious! Definitely coming back if I had the chance!
author: Stacey W.

description:
I had my first ever dinner in the USA at Kippu. It wasn't too shabby. Food gets 3 stars and the great service adds another star to the overall rating. 

Between my partner and I we had a serving of the soft shell crab, which was so-so, not too authentic. With clam sushi which wasn't too bad too. 

We asked for recommendations for ramen and the spicy miso was suggested. It did not disappoint! Because all the other Yelpers have been going on about the Flaming Dragon, we decided to give it a try... It got a mixed reaction, my partner didn't like the smell left by the wax used to burn the outside of the foil. I thought it was okay. 

We had 2 drinks, a sprite and some hot green tea and it all came up to $45 (tip incl)

All in all, a good experience. Staff were friendly, obliging and initiative. The dude even gave me a glass of water without me asking. Good stuff!
author: Jeremiah N.

description:
So my friend and I traversed Japantown in San Francisco in hopes of finding a place that served Oyster Shooters.  I mean I've had some good Oyster Shooters back in the day but most of them were from Southern California and after moving to Miami for a few years and moving back to the Bay Area, boy how I've missed a good Oyster Shooter.  Their Kippu has them!  They're tricky in that it's not listed under drinks but deeply entrenched in their Appetizer section.  What's interesting is that their Oyster Shooters are of a red color.  They do have the oyster, sake, roe and scallion but I don't know what makes it red.  Either way, it was rather disappointing.  I don't think I'd go again for their Oyster Shooters.

Okay, Oyster Shooter aside, the atmosphere was really nice, it's at a lower level so when you look out the window you're seeing people's feet but that has a nice feel to it.  Their service is decently fast and friendly, for the most part.  My buddy and I just ordered beer, sake and appetizers.  Their appetizers are pretty good, we ordered their raw oysters, seaweed, tofu and some other stuff?  I don't remember anymore. 

One note, do not order their cold tofu, it's just tofu you buy from a store cut up and served.  I added my own soy sauce :( 

Anyway, we had a good time here, maybe because we were drinking heavily, since that tend to make things "happier" for people.  Overall experience was good but all the foods we ordered came drastically short of our expectations except for the raw oysters and the beer.  But it's not like they brewed the beer, so just the raw oysters.  Their appetizers definitely need an overhaul.
author: James Y.

description: Best quality fish (sashimi) in the area.  It was nice to be greeted in the classic Japanese way when you enter... Irashaimaseeeiiiieieieii!!!!  :). Took me back to my time in Japan.  Lovely service.
author: Brian D.

description:
I wanted to substitute soba noodles for the ramen in the veggie soup (I'm trying to go with whole grains).  After I got comfortable and was served a small bowl of miso soup I was told that they wouldn't make it for me.  Hmmm?  "You've made it for me once before," I say.  The waiter goes back to try again.  There is some heated conversation and he comes out and says, "He doesn't want to make it. You can only have cold soba, that's it.  He doesn't like to put soba in the soup."  Ha!  No soba soup for you!

I'm not sure what the big fuss was, but it was clear that they would rather see a customer walk, than serve something off menu!  Very odd.  As it turns out I did walk -- a half block down the street to a lovely place called Toraya.  And right there on their menu is soba veggie soup -- before long I had a big steaming hot bowl of soba, fresh veggies and tofu in a flavorful broth.  Perfect!  And Toraya's atmosphere is so much more friendly and down to earth compared to the snooty vibe of Kippu.  

Forget Kippu -- take a walk and visit Toraya!
author: Johnnie R.

description:
I wanted to give it 1.5 stars for the quality of sushi, but because we got complimentary miso soup and salad I will round up and not down for 2 stars. 

We asked what fish was good today and he said salmon so we tried it. Salmon was very good. Other than that, all the fish was blah and not very fresh. If you go here just stick with the recommendation of the chef and don't order anything else. We ended up getting a few salmon sashimi to ensure we had something edible. Just to be clear, I am probably a sushi snob so try the place if you'd like and maybe you'll enjoy it. I try not to totally bash restaurants on yelp!.
author: Ally V.

description:
Decent place for sushi. Definitely not the best, but decent for the price. They have a lot of options for rolls, which were just ok. The fish quality could have been better, but you get what you pay for. 

Service was great though, they were very friendly. That being said, there are better places to eat for sushi at a comparable price.
author: Christina R.

description: A group of 8 went for a lunch for some nigiri, sashimi, and rolls.  Super generous portion at very reasonable price!  For being a person who's allergic to raw fish, this restaurant was perfect because they got so many rolls on the menu.  I will definitely go back!  ^^
author: Jee C.

description: Came here for sushi lunch,  most other places were either closed because it was a Monday or it's past 2pm. Anyways, service was pretty slow the sushi chef and one hostess/ waitress manned the whole restaurant. We tried four sushi rolls: the Super California, Forrest Gump, Lion King and the Delicious.  The sushi was standard and the prices were average, howeVer, they used imitation crab in the rolls.  It was all mayonaisey and stuff, definitely a peeve of mine. The tuna on the Delicious was pretty fresh. Solid 3 stars for overall experience.
author: Shushi S.

description:
As you can tell from the reviews of this place, it's a bit hit or miss.

Unfortunately, it seems like they left our rolls sitting on their kitchen counter for about half an hour. Luckily, the food was still delicious. But it was a bit ludicrous that we just did not receive our food. If someone is going on break, someone better pick up their slack. 

Pretty much can't make up for that. Won't be back.
author: Timothy L.

description: This place has been pretty consistent with good sushi, udon, tempera, and teriyaki. Service has been good for us as well. We have eaten here many times and not ever had a problem. My elderly auntie once griped about the soba served cold (thats the way they serve it) but she remembers not to order it here since she likes hers hot. Lunch bento prices are a good deal. This is our "good ole standby" Japanese restaurant in Japantown.
author: Barb B.

description:
This place was absolutely awesome! We showed up unexpectedly with 9 people and, to be honest, we were somewhat loud and obnoxious. But they were more than gracious in working with us. We ended up having several more people meet up with us and they were still extremely patient and gracious. In the end, not only did we get great service but we also were comped some amazing flame rolls, a pitcher of beer, and a large thing of saki.

All that plus the fact that the sushi was superb!

I know of many places that would've refused us service, or would have wanted us out as fast as possible, but Kippu was simply terrific. I would definitely go back and would recommend others to go there also!
author: Ray K.

description: despite all the negative reviews here, I have enjoyed when I dined in Kippu. The servers were attentive and nice even though it was kind of busy, but still tried to help everyone in the room. the sushi was fresh and the rolls were very delicious as well!
author: Julie P.

description: Great customer service. Amazing age-dash tofu, tofu steak in the bento box was a bit bland. Bonzai and salmon ceviche roll were delicious! Definitely coming back here.
author: Emma J.

description: Expected so much more from a sushi place located in Japan town. Sushi was not good. They also don't take Amex. Expected more :/
author: Naruby S.

description: This place is great! Delicious sushi and mochi ice cream. Kinda small but it has a great atmosphere.  Definitely recommend this place.
author: Angel M.

description: We ordered $64 worth of sushi & sashimi. They gave us three little packets of soy sauce. Their sashimi wasn't fresh and we had to throw out about 30% of them.. I would not recommend this place to anyone visiting Japantown.
author: Olive Y.

description: I really liked this place, good sushi at a good price. I can't remember what the name of the sushi roll I got, I think the Lion King, that they set on fire and bring to your table. Very cool experience.
author: Erica D.

description: Came for a late lunch and had two kinds of sushi rolls. Bottom line...pricey and the fish was not fresh on either roll...tuna and salmon. Staff were very friendly.
author: Mr. B.

description: They make great sushi at Kippu. It's very westernized but still has good Japanese quality. I have come here for lunch several times and have loved what I got each time. The serving sizes are large and prices are good. If it's busy you can get your food slowly because there is just one Sushi chef but it's worth the wait.
author: Molly M.

description: Meh.  They seemed confused when I asked for sashimi.  The Ferrari roll sounded promising, and both times I have ordered it, the spicy tuna tasted and smelled really fishy.  I don't know that they are committed to quality.  I think this is not Japanese owned, and it has a weak sake menu.  Not coming back.  :/
author: Scott L.

description:
Terrible experience! Pick any other place, there are plenty of choices in Japantown.

The waitress forgot half our order and even then brought out the wrong stuff the first time. This was a Thursday afternoon with only one other occupied table , so it's not like she was busy.

The food was mediocre. Both the Katsudon and Tobiko were clearly old. And the waitress argued that they only buy small amounts of tobiko so it couldn't possible be old. 

The miso was alright.
author: Bradford H.

description:
I went into Kippu having read the Yelp reviews, so I knew the meals could be a bit hit-and-miss. I feel (though I have not checked for myself) that their sushi and bentos would be good, but I decided to order the beef donburi, edamame, yakitori, and tempura ice cream.
