As a (half) Japanese-American who has visited Japan throughout her life, I would say the beef donburi was OK. Nothing special, though I felt it was a bit interesting, given that the beef/egg and added vegetables were about 50/50 with the rice, something I was not expecting or used to. The edamame was not well mixed with the salt, but it was good. The yakitori was good, no complaints there. The best part, and most redeeming quality of the meal was the tempura ice cream. It was a unique dessert, and I was pleasantly surprised.

I would go to Kippu again just for the desserts, and I look forward to trying a bento and some sushi there in the future.
author: Rina R.

description: When I moved near Japan town I started my search for a "regular" sushi place.  Kippu has since become my place to stroll to when a mid-week sushi craving hits.  The rolls are excellent; generous portions and fun ingredient combinations.
author: Katrina N.

description: One of the best sushis youll have here in JapanTown / SF. I absolutely love the rolls, raw sushi, and the people that works here. The Flaming Dragon is what makes the place stand out so much more than any other place here. I have taken almost 15 different people to eat here over the course of the year (quality sushi tends to be pricey^^) and not one person told me they didnt like the sushi there. About 50% of them told me it was the best they have ever had.
author: Daniel K.

description: Definitely have to try the flaming dragon, it was really good!
author: Savitre S.

description: The food was terrible here.  I was here on business from Chicago and thought coming to Japantown for a great sushi dinner would be the smart move.  Sat at the sushi bar with a work colleague and the tip off should have been the lukewarm tap beer that we were served.  Never understand a place that can't get the simple things like a cold beer right.  From there it was downhill.  We tried a couple of rolls and nigiri sushi.  The roll was horribly put together by some young kid that had no business being behind the sushi bar. The roll was practically falling apart. The fish for the nigiri sushi was sliced incorrectly and the nigiri itself was not properly shaped or portioned.  Not to mention no selection of fish to speak of and not very good quality fish.  This was a Friday night!  This is not an authentic Japanese restaurant (I know I am Japanese).  The people making the sushi are not experienced or qualified and quality was terrible.   After a couple of tastes we abandoned this place.  Very disappointing experience.
author: John S.

description:
The sushi was pretty decent but by no means the very best I've had. I thought the prices were pretty reasonable for the quantity.

What I didn't like was that they immediately brought our bill out to us. I always think it's a bit rude when restaurants do that. I know you want to get us in and out as quickly as possible but at least let me finish eating.
author: Leanne S.

description:
I have given this place three tries.

Pros: Fair Japanese food, so-so sushi, have never waited for a seat in the three times I've been here.

Cons: VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. We came here Sunday afternoon for lunch and served by a hostess in training. I have tolerance for mistakes (got two of our orders wrong), and a language barrier (I could not understand much of what she was saying, and she had difficulty answering our menu questions). However,  I do NOT have tolerance for rudeness. We ordered oysters, and she brought us an oyster shooter. When we questioned the order she challenged us and said "you did NOT say 'fresh' oysters".  

We will not be returning. We hoped for a pleasant meal, and left exhausted/ticked off that we had to struggle through the entire meal. 

Bottomline: I suggest take-out.
author: J K.

description: I actually like the waiter, they ask us if we wanted anything else when we were half way done with our sushi. I'm satisfied with the waiter and food. They have nice manners when my friend and I walk in to the restaurant.
author: Shirley H.

description: Visited for lunch and ordered the teriyaki beef bento box. The usual fare. Nothing to complain about. However, when I tried to pay with my Charles Schwab debit card, the waitress informed me that they don't accept credit/debit cards for meals under $12. So I had to fish around in my pocket for cash.
author: Koogmo ..

description: The food is ok, and most of the experience is good, however ! When we still working on the last plate like in a half way, one of the server just dropped the check to us without asking anything and left. This is absolutely unacceptable ! So rude !!! I was about to rate at least 4 stars , but this move just changed my mind, the 2 stars is for the food today
author: Kevin W.

description:
I've never ordered bad food that I refuse to eat before until now. Wow!!!
Flaming dragon was flaming in all the bad ways possible. It tasted like charred salty sticky rice.
Soft shell crab was good after I pealed off the batter that was the thickness of an orange peal.
Lobster roll was decent, but the number of rolls in the picture did not depict reality.
The fried oyster also had that charred aroma lathered in the brown dipping sauce that prevented me from finishing the single piece on my plate. I have lost the battle of "Man Vs Food" and cannot raise my head high any longer.
Should have ordered a bento box.
And "yes"; the service was sssllloooooooowwww...
Two stars because I didn't throw up.
author: Mac P.

description: Ordered one of the lunch box items and it was great. Portions for the price was awesome. Service was fast and all food was cooked appropriately.
author: Matt G.

description:
their food is good, in my opinion.  i had a bento.... cause i love the smaller portion and how you get little of many things.  healthier that way.  

one of the thing that was in my bento was california roll.  california roll is always just ok to me.  the california rolls i had here was better than all the other ones i had though.  i don't know why.   my bf liked his food as well.

the reason i didn't give 5 stars was because of the service.  the server didn't seem friendly at all.
author: R F.

description: Service : little slow. I just ordered & paid after I finished . Food: fail . I strongly don't recommend dinning here.
author: JP C.

description: Numerous items were not available, sashimi had bones it in, forgot to bring part of our meal, and lots of fruit flies flying around. Wouldn't come back.
author: Karina S.

description:
I would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone!!  I had the extreme displeasure of dining here this afternoon with my daughter and a close friend.  We had a terrible experience, a terrible lunch, and terrible service.  

After close to an hour of complete and utter disappointment, we all got up and left.  We were disgusted by the experience and the poor service.  

I ordered 2 sushi rolls and I was served quickly.  The rolls were mediocre, and the fish did not taste fresh.  My daughter and my friend ordered Bento Boxes for lunch.  The wait for their lunch was endless - over 45 minutes!!  Unacceptable!! 

From the start, the service was completely lacking - - our water and hot tea did not arrive for over 30 minutes.  After sitting for 45 minutes, we finally were served cold Miso soup which tasted horrible.  When we were told the lunch entrees were "ready" in the kitchen, it was still another 15 minutes before they were brought to the table.  At this point, we had been sitting for an hour.  We decided at this point that we could no longer tolerate the extreme lack of service.  We all three got up to leave.  The manager came over and spoke to us very rudely saying that we should stay to eat the food ordered.  We said we would not, and that we would not pay for it either.  This got the manager very angry, and he screamed at us.  I paid for the Sushi rolls which I had eaten an hour earlier, while my daughter and my friend sat waiting and waiting for the food, which would finally arrive an hour later.  

San Francisco is filled with amazing restaurants - THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM!! I would never return the restaurant Kippu, and I will tell my family and friends about the awful experience I had today.  I had wanted to take my young daughter out to a nice lunch in the city, which would normally have been a memorable treat for both of us.  Instead, we had a really bad experience, and it was extremely disappointing.
author: Sarah S.

description:
it is really surprising that considering how much of a foodie heaven SF is that sushi is not that good. ive been told by people that because of SF's geographic location it is not a great place for fresh sushi. but nonetheless:

this is a pretty good spot for sushi given sf. la is definitely better but they have a good amount of rolls. good selection, conveniently located in japantown, and also yummy miso soup!

i had a couple of the lunch specials, my favorite one was the salmon lunch special. i would highly recommend it!
author: Thach N.

description: The food was decent except the flaming ones, which smelled and tastes like butane, the service was awful.  Total attitude and they keep missing the order, and missing the rolls, and bring out rolls that wasn't ordered, the restaurant isn't even that busy to mix up orders
author: Linda C.

description:
Overall, sushi was great (nigiri and rolls) and price was fair

Good price on Nigiri (less than $5) and most rolls were reasonably priced but could go up as high as $15 if you wanted a lot of fish in them

My top sushi place (so far) in the area (of about 6 tried)
author: Steve G.

description: Waitress... you are VERY VERY rude... I told you it was my first time here and needed recommendation and obviously you don't give a .. p00p. Seriously, why are you even a waitress?? what did I ever do to you?? Definitely not thinking about coming back... I really wish I asked for your name... but three stars for delicious dishes and friendly sushi chefs, maybe I should peek in through the windows to see if this girl is working before I walk in again. Thanks for ruining our dinner that night.
author: Annie Y.

description: This is a cool place. Atmosphere was informal, especially at the bar where we could watch the chaos of the chefs at work :-) Food was tasty, highlights being the sushi roll we had as an extra to our "dinner bento" (large portion by the way!). Bags of character and friendly, affable staff.
author: Gareth E.

description: I like this place.  When I'm looking for a hearty, stomach filling bento, I come here. I wouldn't say it's the best in all the land, but it's good enough to keep me coming back often.  You get huge portions at a great price and everyone who works here is incredibly friendly from the moment you walk in.
author: Juv C.

description: Ok how do you f up sushi. First start with a sushi chef who does not care about what he makes . My shrimp roll showed up with tail in it but no shrimp . Crunchy tail no meat . And it was a mess $10.00 dollars per roll and smaller then the length of my chop sticks. There are 2 super markets one to the left and one to the right around the corner. Both of them have better sushi on their worst days. Really one star that they don't deserve
author: William W.

description: Average food. I expect more in this part of town. Limited selection, friendly service.
author: Zeus M.

description: While shopping through japantown I needed a quick between lunch and dinner snack. Since it was an awkward time most of the places nearby were closed with the exception of Kippu. I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished! However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore... I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor. The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own. The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up. The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen! I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
author: Danielle S.

description: Don't bother! Bad service and rolls much smaller than photos in menu! Had to ask for everything! Water, more water, the rest of our order, the bill, everything! The sushi was mediocre, only plus was rolls came with miso soup and salad-but not all. Go into the restaurants in the mall for a mug better meal!!!!! Service was SO bad!!!!!!!
author: foodlubber v.

description:
I've lived in SF for almost 5 years now, and i'm a huge lover of sushi. I lived in Japan for about 8 months after high school and have eaten all over the country, and now that i've lived in SF i've eaten sushi all over town here.

Kippu was suggested by a friend and their menu outside had a bigger assortment of delicious looking rolls than anywhere else i'd seen. Their prices are fair and not ridiculous, but not so cheap it makes you worried! Their portions are BIG, no 4 piece sushi rolls for 12 but instead 6-8 piece rolls for around 8-13 and stuffed full! 

What really sold me was how GREAT the food tastes, and how awesome the staff is. They joked, talked and had a lot of fun with me and the other customers at the Sushi bar all throughout our service. 

The owner even gave me and my friend a free and DELICIOUS tuna plate just because we said how much we enjoyed his food and service. He was an awesome sushi chef too! 

This is definitely my new hang out spot after work for my friends and myself.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Food was not good, service was not good.

- Tonkotsu ramen was pretty bad with terrible overcooked noodles and tough meat.
- Octopus sunomono was foul.
- Chicken teriyaki was meh, rice stale.
- Gyoza was not fresh and not good.
- Edamame was not fresh and not good.
- Service was slow and poor, one item never came.

Maybe a bad day?
author: Jonathan P.

description: Five stars for the ramen soup, oyster shooters, and superb service from a guy named Green...
author: Craig L.

description: Food was decent, but service was sup-par. The waitress seemed to be annoyed with us the whole time and was trying to hurry us out. There were only a few other tables occupied so I don't understand what the rush was (it was also not at closing time). She cleared our plates when we weren't finished and didnt even bother asking if we were done yet. There are many other sushi restaurants to choose from in Japantown- I will definitely not be going back to this one.
author: Lisa K.

description: I absolutely love Kippu. Choosing a sushi place in Japan Town is difficult, but if you go to Kippu you will not be disappointed! Amazing menu with some definitely adventurous (the flaming dragon roll is LITERALLY on fire). I love so many options on their menu that it is always hard to decide what to order.  They also have great happy hour drink prices, and the staff is so fun and friendly! I always have a great sushi dining experience at Kippu!
author: Bridget B.

description:
hit or miss.

i used to go pretty often when it opened, and their then-manager, jenny, was uber awesome.  made me feel so at home.
'green' the owner is a hoot.  really sweet guy.
oogi is competent and friendly when you catch him on a good day.

i've gone home with a funny tummy after a meal there a couple of times.

not the best ramen since ramen underground in FiDi trumps them, but still pretty good.
i like their sushi rolls for the most part but the item descriptions aren't always what you may get on your plate.

if you're hungry, nearby, yes, have a bite there.
but i wouldn't make a trip out just to eat here.  it's kind of my 'back-up' neighborhood place.
author: s t.

description:
Food was great and reasonably priced. We came in as a party of five and all ordered different bento boxes. The food was set in good proportions, enough to make us all food. And matched with soup and tea on the side (which was okay in taste), we all ate happily. 

Service was mediocre. We had only sat down for less than ten minutes, and the waitress had come to ask us for our orders two or three times already. And it wasn't like there were a lot of other customers waiting to be seated, so there really was no reason to rush us. So that was rather unpleasant. 

But yeah, overall, I liked it here.
author: Marie L.

description: Fantastic food and really fun! Owner is fun and really nice too :)
author: Marissa M.

description: Wonderful place, I came here for lunch during a work break between patients. It was pouring rain out, I ordered a bento box with grilled teriyaki salmon. The waitress was very sweet and the sushi chef very welcoming. She immediately brought me hot green tea and miso soup. I realized I accidentally left my purse in my car, she lent me a large umbrella and said no problem to go and look for it. I walked in the rain to my car and sadly couldn't find it! It was in another purse back home...I came back and told them I couldn't find my wallet and sadly couldn't pay, very embarrasses of course. The sushi chef was very kind and immediately told me to stay and eat, the meal was on him this time. Such generosity and very sweet of him. I will definitely be back for sushi again and promise to give him an extra big tip for his generosity. Wonderful restaurant and really good sushi. Kind hearted staff.
author: Emmy L.

description:
The sushi rolls here are delicious, and so is the seaweed salad. The fish used in my sushi was definitely fresh, and being very keen on sushi freshness, this is a big deal. The prices were also very reasonable, which is great seeing that sushi is normally expensive for good quality. 

The one complaint I have is that it is very cramped in the restaurant.
author: Samantha M.

description: Party of 5 went Saturday night around 7:30 pm. Pretty busy. We had 2 Flaming Dragon rolls (gotta watch, pretty impressive, and the waiters talk it up too as they're serving it), Lion Head, Cherry Blossom and 3-4 others. Also had Wakame Salad. Service was a bit slow, but they were pretty busy, so I'm not slamming them much. Sushi was pretty tasty. I'd definitely go again!
author: June W.

description:
The first time I went there was a 5/5. (It's probably because we're sitting near the front with the bright sunlight etc and we had a different waitress.) 

However, the second time was kind of a bad experience. 
The food alone is 4.5/5 (the miso soup felt like it's salt water taken out of the ocean. Too "salty". But everything else was so good.)

Although I still love the good, I am hesitating to go back or not because:

1) The waitress who served us this time seems to have an attitude. I asked for a soy sauce plate but she just pointed to the small space where the wasabi was placed in the middle of the bento and said this was it. But that part of the bento box was DISGUSTINGLY HORRIBLE. The paint of that part of the box seems to be all scratched up! I don't want to put soy sauce in there to dip. Also I asked her for a soysauce plate because the last time I went to to eat, the other waitress just gave me one without asking so I assumed that I will get one this time as well. I just dislike the attitude of the waitress this time. She always seems to look pissed. She only had one expression throughout the whole meal time: semi-angry look.

2) I really wonder about if they do cleaning or not. If you sit near the end half of the restaurant, there are so much bugs flying! My friend and I were basically "accompanied" by 5 or more of those bug flying around out food. I would be better off eating a take out outside in the streets than sitting inside. 

3) Old dishware. The paint on the bowl of the miso soup was all gone on the brim. The bottom of the bento box looked like it was all scratched up. It all just looks dangerous to eat on. 

4) Slow service. My friend and I ordered food earlier than 2 other customers who came in. However, they all got their food and was eating for a good amount of time already before we got or food. We just ordered simply bento boxes like them, nothing special.
author: Musica Z.

description: First time here and it won't be my last, convenient Japanese joint in JTown, with good food, good size portions, & service from Heidi =)
author: J C.

description: Amazing! Why?? because I used to hate Sushi until I tried Kippus. Trust me, it takes a long time for me to get into something that I never like in the first place, but my overall experience here, changed all that! Thanks Chefs! :-)
author: Gail B.

description: Yum sushi, we went twice during a 3 day visit!  I highly recommend the Washington Roll (Salmon with lemon).   Asparagus is deep fried in the rolls which is not my thing.  Service was good.
author: Sarah H.

description: The lunch box here is great, the portion is large and the sashimi taste good.
author: Jessica Z.

description: Had the Chirashi. It was filling and service was awesome. They also have ramen too.
author: Johnson H.

description: Great selections of specialty rolls, and the fish tasted good and fresh... great sushi spot in Japantown...
author: A S.

description: 3.5? Good for non-expensive Calfornia-style sushi. They have an extensive list of mix-and-match rolls.  We only had two rolls here. You must get the Washington roll!
author: Nadiyah S.

description: we enjoyed veggie lunch twice, both experience were very good. tempura and coroque are crispy, yet very fluffy yum stuff inside. sushi rolls are good in tinier size with softly cooked rice. we liked the miso soup and even salad with yum dressing. only, the size of the portion is really big. it's like 130 percent of american size, if compared with a sort of standard japanese restaurant lunch size, it can be twice more. i usually dont waste food, but i can't finish.
author: Chiemi K.

description: Average sushi with subpar service. The owner was very rude and it was completely empty during dinner time, I know why now. -__-
author: AJ N.

description: I actually really liked this place regardless of all the bad reviews.  Most people complained about the temperature of the room and the seating. I didn't mind it. I love the oyster shooter and my pepper fin dish.  Yummy!!  Thank u kippu
author: Kay V.

description: Quick, friendly, fresh and tasty - best rolls experience in Japantown so far. Plus, huge selection of special rolls and welcome miso soup. Will stop by again!
author: Den M.

description: Tasty! Service was amazing. All I had to do was think about asking for extra wasabi, and there it was on the table. Portions are on the large size. I will return!
author: Nick F.

description:
I've been here a couple times and the sushi is always great. Sometimes the portions are pretty small depending on the roll but most of them are a pretty decent size. When I first started coming here, the service was so nice and I really liked the combination of cordial service and good food. 
HOWEVER, today I went in with my family to have a nice family dinner because we were familiar with the place. But we didn't like the table that they first directed us to. Not to be a snippy sally but one of the waitresses was just giving us some attitude when we tried asking for another table. After finally convincing her to give us another table (the first one was in the sun and my mom gets really bad migraines), she just continued to have this unwelcoming face. 
The food is good, but this isn't the first time this waitress has had some sort of attitude when serving my table. It kind of puts you off from the experience.
author: Hue H.

description: It was my first time to this restaurant and I have to say I have never written a review on yelp but I couldn't keep quiet. As we were eating our bento lunch boxes, a cockroach crawled on the table. The friend I was with then told me that she felt bad saying something but when we walked into the restaurant there was a cockroach on the floor crawling around. As we left the restaurant I saw another one and boy was the carpet nasty. Enough said....
author: Nonion V.

description: Horrible place, came in around 10pm last night and the waiters were looking at us crazy. We were a group of 7 and they seated us at the corner with little space. The waiter seem to be rude. As we were eating a food a different waiter was grabbing the soy sauce and other things. In the end of all this, they were rushing us to get out because they closed at 11pm. It was only 10:30pm by the time we were done eating, I would never come back here again.
author: Mindy P.

description: Needed something small for lunch since we have plans for dinner. So we headed across the street to find some sushi...we are in Japantown damnit it should not be that hard ( though yelp reviews said different). We noticed this cute little spot and decided to give it a try. The staff is very friendly and they sat us down quickly. We ordered two rolls....could not tell you what they hell they were if that says anything but they served their purpose like a one night stand. I was going to give them three stars but when I asked for a drink menu the lady said "soda"....I said "no ALCOHOL" she said "soda".  No drinks for the adults!?!?? Give me my damn star back!
author: Carolyn T.

description:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.
author: Michelle T.

description: food was alright. not too good, not too bad. ive had better. not much on their menu, which doesnt please me at all. the waitress was rushing us to order our food which is definitely a no. the other servers were not water friendly with refills. other then that, nothing good to say. we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?). I wish we were told that roll was raw. I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes. I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.
author: Dixie x.

description: The chicken teriyaki in their tempura box was dry. Surprisingly the California roll was nice and fresh. I probably would come back and try their sashimi next time. Place is not bad. Probably ordered the wrong item. Their lunch special are pretty cheap but again just beware that maybe some of the items are just okay. Overall 3 out of 5 stars.
author: J C.

description:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.
author: Ben L.

description: Stay clear unless you want Korean version of Japanese food
author: Zeb F.

description: Had: Java, Super California, and Bay Scallop rolls, with the Kaarage appetizer and a Kirin. Sibs had cocktails that tasted like liquid candy. The food's not bad, and the prices are pretty good.
author: Maximillian M.

description: This is a cute little place away from the main mall of Japan town. It was clean and well lit. The miso was good, tea was good. I ordered the Cherry Blossom rolls but they did not lool like the picture. There was way less tuna wrapped around them then what they show. The dish is 10.00 and change so I was a little disappointed but other then that it was a-ok.
author: Lost B.

description: The waitress was so rude! When we said that we were still deciding in what to order, she slammed her papers in her apron and abruptly turned around and walked away with a horrible expression on her face. She may have been having a bad day, but if she really wants our money, then she needs to learn how to respect her customers. We got up and left. Never going there again.
author: Trisha S.

description: Worse customer service I have ever experienced in Japantown.  Not a suggested place to come if you want great service.
author: Trina B.

description:
Went here twice; once for ramen, once for sushi.  

The miso ramen, I thought, was very low quality stuff.  The flavor of the soup/broth was very weak and bland, and no amount of toppings could balance out the taste.  Not to mention I ate this very late at night when I was very drunk, and I'm rarely picky about food when I'm hammered. I give the ramen 1 star. 

The sushi wasn't bad though.  Compared to most sushi places I've been to, the price was about right for what I got.  The sushi tasted average- not bad, but not terrible either- so no complaints.  And on top of that, the service was relatively quick, and my sushi came out pretty fast.  

Finally, and this isn't all too relevant, but I ordered the cherry blossom sushi, and in the pictures on both the wall and menu it was arranged in a very specific "cherry blossom" shaped arrangement.  However, when they brought the sushi out, it was arranged in a typical sushi row.  I dont know, I just feel like if you're gonna call it the Cherry Blossom, and have it pictured as a cherry blossom, well then you'd better damn well SERVE the thing as a CHERRY BLOSSOM!! lol . 

3 stars total for that
author: Sean S.

description: All I had was the ramen but it was terrible. Obviously from an instant mix and super salty.
author: Nick G.

description: Pretty decent place. Thought it was expensive at first, but the dinner bentos come with LOADS of food. I had the Chicken Teriyaki + Tempura + California Roll. The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect. I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good. The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.
author: Shun Y.

description: Highly recommend this Japanese restaurant! It was my Mom's birthday and the manager, staff and food were fantastic.  The manager gave us a complementary sushi roll and fried ice cream tempura in celebration of my Mom's birthday!  What an awesome surprise :-)  I definitely would come here again!
author: Jessica G.

description: NOT the place to indulge in sushi!! Fish was not fresh- ordered fatty tuna sashimi, yellowtail and salmon. Service was non attentive- was never offered an additional glass of wine or asked if anything additional was desired. Disappointed!!
author: Silvia M.

description: i really can't get in to sushi. I have tried sushi at least a dozen times, and I just can't get in to it...just not my thing. even though I will never be a sushi person, this restaurant is phenomenal. I only ordered the kotate, as far as sushi, which was so dang good, and everything else was equally as good. the miso soup was great, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, and the teriyaki chicken was the best I've ever had. the milky sake we had complemented the meal well, and the service was impeccable. the price wasn't bad either. :)
author: Jasen S.

description: Their sushi was very unfresh. I coukd even taste the bad fish in the spicy tuna roll
author: Sam S.

description: I lunched here on a whim and I wasn't disappointed! Their chickens teriyaki and tempura bento box is extremely cheap ($6), filling, and yummy! The only thing that didn't make sense here was that the chicken teriyaki plate without the tempura was more expensive than the chicken teriyaki and tempura bento box. But other than that, good food and cheap!
author: J L.

description:
Seemed like a good idea, new place in Japantown and looked semi-busy.

Small place, but nice.  Things starting off good.

New waitress knew nothing of the menu.  I wasn't asking for explanation of the menu, she just didn't know what I was saying when I ordered the rolls.  Kind of a bummer, she had to look at the menu to know what to write down.  

Pre meal, you get miso soup and a salad.  Soup was ok.  Salad had a small bug in it.  Major bummer.  When returning the salad, we didn't even get an apology, instead we got a "oh hahaha" kind of like woopsy thing w/o any remorse.

Got the happy hour beer.  Forgot the name of it, but it was fizzy, just as it said on the btl.  Best thing so far.

Got 3 rolls.  To start off, they were all very tiny for the price.  I was then expecting great quality.  Wow, disappointed.  I basically felt they lacked any flavor.  Tuna was blah blah, fried tempura was cold, and I could go on and on.  It basically felt like I was just feeding hunger vs enjoying sushi.

Unfortunately, for a new place, I do not know if they will survive.  You're in Japantown, you should make at least good sushi.  

Overall, will not go back.  Hope they improve on all aspects from service to quality of food.
author: Deon C.

description: The food is so tasty and good, the people there is not so nice, but still I like the place!
author: Nuria V.

description: Very bad service.  Ordered using soup with shrimp tempura.  Asked the waitress if I could have it without chicken listed on the menu. She said yes. 20 minutes later she brings me the soup loaded with chicken & 1 tempura.   When I returned it she said : I thOught u wanted chicken". Had to wait for another 20 minutes to get soup. Almost walked out. Had to request spoon too. Never going back there!
author: Valerie T.

description: Shame on you for not letting my 3 year old use the bathroom. True that I wasn't eating there at the time, but I have eaten there many times. Shame.
author: Emily Q.

description: Beef udon, no good. Super chewy meat that is not even enough amount to eat, weird veggies combination in the soup like zucchini and lots of carrots... Sushi was so so.
author: Yoshimi M.

description: We liked this place. The sushi is good. We ordered the Candy Cane, the Incredible and the something with the word Mexican in it. I can't remember the full name of the last one. They were all really good! They were all under the Special Roll section of the menu. The servers were interesting - there were several girls and one guy that seemed to be serving us, and the guy seemed to be the only one who really knew what was going on. The girls didn't seem to know what they were serving us and couldn't really answer questions. They were friendly though :) The miso soup was good. The salad wasn't as good as I've had it at other Japanese restaurants, but it's a pretty basic salad, so it can't get that bad or good. Oh, and they have cool cocktails! I got the Purple Gecko, my fiance got the Mojito Affair and my cousin got the Plumtini. All very good. Tasted like Jolly Ranchers! :) For the three of us and all that food it cost about $64.
author: Erin A.

description: The sushi is pretty decent - but it is let down by the service. The girl there (we've had the same one the last 3 times) never smiles and isn't very happy to serve us. I would go only for sushi and during a busy time when we might get a different waitress.
author: Amy Y.

description: the service is very terrible lol. waiting so long to order the food. and waiting so long like one hour and 30 mins for the food.  Also, when i Ask the waitress, she asked me that did i place the order, yet. oh, wow. this is shocking me.
author: Crystal T.

description: Normally I feel bad writing a bad review but hands down the worst Asian food I've ever eaten in SF. Ordered the Ramen, which came with linguine noodles and canned corn. Horrifying. Put a ton of siracha on it but couldn't eat more than a few bites. Might be better for sushi, but don't think I'll ever find out. Service wasn't great either.
author: Makenna S.

description: My fam and I found ourselves in Japantown looking for a non-touristy, yummy sushi spot. We tried a well-reviewed-on-Yelp spot inside Peace Plaza but they had a minimum of $20 a person and we just didn't think we could pull that off (plus, I don't like being told what to spend). So we tried Kippu, even though the reviews were mixed on Yelp. For starters, the restaurant was pretty empty except for table right next to us that looked like it was the owner or something. Our waiter greeted us and promptly spilled water right next to me. No harm done and we weren't bothered by the spill at all. Next thing we know, the owner makes sure we ok and a few minutes later, brings us this fancy dish, "The Flaming Dragon." He tries to tell us what we're supposed it to with it...something about smelling and waiting a minute after the flames die out before we open it...but then just tells us he'll be back to help us. IT was this cool looking thing--something long wrapped in foil with flames literally coming from the bottom. So after it's not on fire he comes over and opens it up...it was a super yummy roll with a bunch of fish I can't remember and some of that delicious crab filling. It was delicious and really cool of him to bring it out to us juts because of a little spill. We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good. I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4! My fam got the green tea ice cream and they enjoyed that as well. Overall, it was great start to our SF dining experiences!
author: Angelique D.

description: I came to Kippu for lunch and was delightfully surprised with their quality and prices. The service was amazing and the owner was even out on the floor checking on all of the customers! Would definitely come here again and recommend it for anyone trying to get good food at a great price!
author: carmen s.

description: I am eating here with my family. We waited one whole hour for our food. So the food came out my dad ordered number 1 and the waitress got the order wrong and said she was right. My dad then asked to see the menu as she approach our table with the menu she looked at it and saw she was wrong so she took the order and fixed it. The second time she took it out it was still wrong. Then she came up and was going to get the plate again but we were like cant you just bring out the tempura (which was missing) in another bowl because we waited one hour and shouldn't my dad be able to eat? And she was liked I pressed the wrong button. Since you work at a restaurant shouldn't you know the menu well enough? We were also waiting for hot sauce after asking two different waiters to get it by the time our food was done there was still no hot sauce. The service they have here is horrible I will not be coming here again. I am quite disappointed.
author: Vivian T.

description: I stumbled upon this place while on family trip. My parents were craving sushi, so we decided to try it. The service was ok, but the food took longer than I'd prefer. We got a couple basic rolls, some baked rolls, unagi, and the miso ramen (huge bowl!). Overall, it was alright. I've had better sushi. The restaurant itself was nicely decorated though.
author: Elle D.

description: Recently took a trip to San Francisco for the first time. We stayed in Japantown,and felt compelled to try the local cuisine.Now I must tell you we really knew nothing about sushi or Japanese cuisine.This visit to Kippu started a love for this style of food! We loved it.The hostess Little Jini made excellent recommendations.the waiter Ugi was fantastic ,and even met the chef Green. The food was wonderful and the service was great. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting San Francisco.
author: Marlene R.

description: been here a few times, very normal, but this past Sunday was the worst. ordered a bento box and when it arrived I found a large pubic hair in the tempura box. pubes are unmistakable. it even had the white follicle. so I tell the waitress who didn't seem to understand the gravity of the situation. pubic hairs don't just fall off a person's head into the food. the cook was touching his dick. so the waitress apologizes and says she'll bring me something fresh. comes out 3 mins later with the same bento sans the hair. the worst. No stars.
author: tsyonsyn l.

description: Hey guys, guess what Kippu got beer  now and   Wide selection of wine. At  first time I went to Kippu 3 weeks ago they did not have ABC licence so I had sushi without beer. Which was not complete feeling. But this time it was fullfeeling.
author: Susan W.

description: We really wanted to like this place. We had many choices for Japanese food, but chose this one because the menu looked amazing. We were greeted with a warm welcome, although unlike other Japanese restaurants, the sushi chefs didn't even look up to say hi. So we sat and ordered. So far ok. Then I got my lunch, and having eaten in Japanese restaurants all my life, I know they never serve meals together. It comes as it is ready. So I waited but hubby said to eat. After what seemed like much too long, we asked our server about hubby's lunch. She smiled and said she would check. She never came back to us. 5 more minutes and still no lunch. Asked the guy server, who said he would check, but never saw him again. Finally, after I had finished my lunch we asked our server what had happened and why she never came back with either his food or a status. Found out that they had served my husband's lunch to another table! And they didn't even bother to tell us, nor did they offer to give him lunch on the house for their gross oversight. He was so upset he just asked for the bill and we paid and left. We will never go back and it's too bad because we are very loyal to restaurants who admit a mistake and make amends to customer. Glad they can afford to lose customers.
author: Janet P.
